name: Exodus 18:2
text: Jethro, Moses" father-in-law, received Zipporah, Moses" wife, after he had sent her away,

name: Exodus 18:3
text: and her two sons. The name of one son was Gershom, for Moses said, "I have lived as a foreigner in a foreign land".

name: Exodus 18:4
text: The name of the other was Eliezer, for he said, "My father"s God was my help and delivered me from Pharaoh"s sword."

name: Exodus 18:5
text: Jethro, Moses" father-in-law, came with his sons and his wife to Moses into the wilderness where he was encamped, at the Mountain of God.

name: Exodus 18:6
text: He said to Moses, "I, your father-in-law Jethro, have come to you with your wife, and her two sons with her."

name: Exodus 18:7
text: Moses went out to meet his father-in-law, and bowed and kissed him. They asked each other of their welfare, and they came into the tent.

name: Exodus 18:8
text: Moses told his father-in-law all that Yahweh had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel"s sake, all the hardships that had come on them on the way, and how Yahweh delivered them.

name: Exodus 18:9
text: Jethro rejoiced for all the goodness which Yahweh had done to Israel, in that he had delivered them out of the hand of the Egyptians.

name: Exodus 18:10
text: Jethro said, "Blessed be Yahweh, who has delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of Pharaoh; who has delivered the people from under the hand of the Egyptians.

name: Exodus 18:11
text: Now I know that Yahweh is greater than all gods because of the thing in which they dealt arrogantly against them."

name: Exodus 18:12
text: Jethro, Moses" father-in-law, took a burnt offering and sacrifices for God. Aaron came with all of the elders of Israel, to eat bread with Moses" father-in-law before God.

name: Exodus 18:13
text: It happened on the next day, that Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from the morning to the evening.

name: Exodus 18:14
text: When Moses" father-in-law saw all that he did to the people, he said, "What is this thing that you do for the people? Why do you sit alone, and all the people stand around you from morning to evening?"

name: Exodus 18:15
text: Moses said to his father-in-law, "Because the people come to me to inquire of God.

name: Exodus 18:16
text: When they have a matter, they come to me, and I judge between a man and his neighbor, and I make them know the statutes of God, and his laws."

name: Exodus 18:17
text: Moses" father-in-law said to him, "The thing that you do is not good.

name: Exodus 18:18
text: You will surely wear away, both you, and this people that is with you; for the thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to perform it yourself alone.

name: Exodus 18:19
text: Listen now to my voice. I will give you counsel, and God be with you. You represent the people before God, and bring the causes to God.

name: Exodus 18:20
text: You shall teach them the statutes and the laws, and shall show them the way in which they must walk, and the work that they must do.

name: Exodus 18:21
text: Moreover you shall provide out of all the people able men, such as fear God: men of truth, hating unjust gain; and place such over them, to be rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

name: Exodus 18:22
text: Let them judge the people at all times. It shall be that every great matter they shall bring to you, but every small matter they shall judge themselves. So shall it be easier for you, and they shall share the load with you.

name: Exodus 18:23
text: If you will do this thing, and God commands you so, then you will be able to endure, and all of these people also will go to their place in peace."

name: Exodus 18:24
text: So Moses listened to the voice of his father-in-law, and did all that he had said.

name: Exodus 18:25
text: Moses chose able men out of all Israel, and made them heads over the people, rulers of thousands, rulers of hundreds, rulers of fifties, and rulers of tens.

name: Exodus 18:26
text: They judged the people at all times. They brought the hard causes to Moses, but every small matter they judged themselves.

name: Exodus 18:27
text: Moses let his father-in-law depart, and he went his way into his own land.

name: Exodus 19:1
text: In the third month after the children of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that same day they came into the wilderness of Sinai.

name: Exodus 19:2
text: When they had departed from Rephidim, and had come to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mountain.

name: Exodus 19:3
text: Moses went up to God, and Yahweh called to him out of the mountain, saying, "This is what you shall tell the house of Jacob, and tell the children of Israel:

name: Exodus 19:4
text: "You have seen what I did to the Egyptians, and how I bore you on eagles" wings, and brought you to myself.

name: Exodus 19:5
text: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice, and keep my covenant, then you shall be my own possession from among all peoples; for all the earth is mine;

name: Exodus 19:6
text: and you shall be to me a kingdom of priests, and a holy nation." These are the words which you shall speak to the children of Israel."

name: Exodus 19:7
text: Moses came and called for the elders of the people, and set before them all these words which Yahweh commanded him.

name: Exodus 19:8
text: All the people answered together, and said, "All that Yahweh has spoken we will do." Moses reported the words of the people to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 19:9
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Behold, I come to you in a thick cloud, that the people may hear when I speak with you, and may also believe you forever." Moses told the words of the people to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 19:10
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Go to the people, and sanctify them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their garments,

name: Exodus 19:11
text: and be ready against the third day; for on the third day Yahweh will come down in the sight of all the people on Mount Sinai.

name: Exodus 19:12
text: You shall set bounds to the people all around, saying, "Be careful that you don"t go up onto the mountain, or touch its border. Whoever touches the mountain shall be surely put to death.

name: Exodus 19:13
text: No hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through; whether it is animal or man, he shall not live." When the trumpet sounds long, they shall come up to the mountain."

name: Exodus 19:14
text: Moses went down from the mountain to the people, and sanctified the people; and they washed their clothes.

name: Exodus 19:15
text: He said to the people, "Be ready by the third day. Don"t have sexual relations with a woman."

name: Exodus 19:16
text: It happened on the third day, when it was morning, that there were thunders and lightnings, and a thick cloud on the mountain, and the sound of an exceedingly loud trumpet; and all the people who were in the camp trembled.

name: Exodus 19:17
text: Moses led the people out of the camp to meet God; and they stood at the lower part of the mountain.

name: Exodus 19:18
text: Mount Sinai, all it, smoked, because Yahweh descended on it in fire; and its smoke ascended like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked greatly.

name: Exodus 19:19
text: When the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him by a voice.

name: Exodus 19:20
text: Yahweh came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain. Yahweh called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.

name: Exodus 19:21
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Go down, warn the people, lest they break through to Yahweh to gaze, and many of them perish.

name: Exodus 19:22
text: Let the priests also, who come near to Yahweh, sanctify themselves, lest Yahweh break forth on them."

name: Exodus 19:23
text: Moses said to Yahweh, "The people can"t come up to Mount Sinai, for you warned us, saying, "Set bounds around the mountain, and sanctify it.""

name: Exodus 19:24
text: Yahweh said to him, "Go down and you shall bring Aaron up with you, but don"t let the priests and the people break through to come up to Yahweh, lest he break forth on them."

name: Exodus 19:25
text: So Moses went down to the people, and told them.

name: Exodus 20:1
text: God spoke all these words, saying,

name: Exodus 20:2
text: "I am Yahweh your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage.

name: Exodus 20:3
text: "You shall have no other gods before me.

name: Exodus 20:4
text: "You shall not make for yourselves an idol, nor any image of anything that is in the heavens above, or that is in the earth beneath, or that is in the water under the earth:

name: Exodus 20:5
text: you shall not bow yourself down to them, nor serve them, for I, Yahweh your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, on the third and on the fourth generation of those who hate me,

name: Exodus 20:6
text: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.

name: Exodus 20:7
text: "You shall not take the name of Yahweh your God in vain, for Yahweh will not hold him guiltless who takes his name in vain.

name: Exodus 20:8
text: "Remember the Sabbath day, to keep it holy.

name: Exodus 20:9
text: You shall labor six days, and do all your work,

name: Exodus 20:10
text: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to Yahweh your God. You shall not do any work in it, you, nor your son, nor your daughter, your male servant, nor your female servant, nor your livestock, nor your stranger who is within your gates;

name: Exodus 20:11
text: for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore Yahweh blessed the Sabbath day, and made it holy.

name: Exodus 20:12
text: "Honor your father and your mother, that your days may be long in the land which Yahweh your God gives you.

name: Exodus 20:13
text: "You shall not murder.

name: Exodus 20:14
text: "You shall not commit adultery.

name: Exodus 20:15
text: "You shall not steal.

name: Exodus 20:16
text: "You shall not give false testimony against your neighbor.

name: Exodus 20:17
text: "You shall not covet your neighbor"s house. You shall not covet your neighbor"s wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor"s."

name: Exodus 20:18
text: All the people perceived the thunderings, the lightnings, the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking. When the people saw it, they trembled, and stayed at a distance.

name: Exodus 20:19
text: They said to Moses, "Speak with us yourself, and we will listen; but don"t let God speak with us, lest we die."

name: Exodus 20:20
text: Moses said to the people, "Don"t be afraid, for God has come to test you, and that his fear may be before you, that you won"t sin."

name: Exodus 20:21
text: The people stayed at a distance, and Moses drew near to the thick darkness where God was.

name: Exodus 20:22
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "This is what you shall tell the children of Israel: "You yourselves have seen that I have talked with you from heaven.

name: Exodus 20:23
text: You shall most certainly not make alongside of me gods of silver, or gods of gold for yourselves.

name: Exodus 20:24
text: You shall make an altar of earth for me, and shall sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and your peace offerings, your sheep and your cattle. In every place where I record my name I will come to you and I will bless you.

name: Exodus 20:25
text: If you make me an altar of stone, you shall not build it of cut stones; for if you lift up your tool on it, you have polluted it.

name: Exodus 20:26
text: Neither shall you go up by steps to my altar, that your nakedness may not be exposed to it."

name: Exodus 21:1
text: "Now these are the ordinances which you shall set before them.

name: Exodus 21:2
text: "If you buy a Hebrew servant, he shall serve six years and in the seventh he shall go out free without paying anything.

name: Exodus 21:3
text: If he comes in by himself, he shall go out by himself. If he is married, then his wife shall go out with him.

name: Exodus 21:4
text: If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the wife and her children shall be her master"s, and he shall go out by himself.

name: Exodus 21:5
text: But if the servant shall plainly say, "I love my master, my wife, and my children. I will not go out free;"

name: Exodus 21:6
text: then his master shall bring him to God, and shall bring him to the door or to the doorpost, and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall serve him for ever.

name: Exodus 21:7
text: "If a man sells his daughter to be a female servant, she shall not go out as the male servants do.

name: Exodus 21:8
text: If she doesn"t please her master, who has married her to himself, then he shall let her be redeemed. He shall have no right to sell her to a foreign people, since he has dealt deceitfully with her.

name: Exodus 21:9
text: If he marries her to his son, he shall deal with her as a daughter.

name: Exodus 21:10
text: If he takes another wife to himself, he shall not diminish her food, her clothing, and her marital rights.

name: Exodus 21:11
text: If he doesn"t do these three things for her, she may go free without paying any money.

name: Exodus 21:12
text: "One who strikes a man so that he dies shall surely be put to death,

name: Exodus 21:13
text: but not if it is unintentional, but God allows it to happen: then I will appoint you a place where he shall flee.

name: Exodus 21:14
text: If a man schemes and comes presumptuously on his neighbor to kill him, you shall take him from my altar, that he may die.

name: Exodus 21:15
text: "Anyone who attacks his father or his mother shall be surely put to death.

name: Exodus 21:16
text: "Anyone who kidnaps someone and sells him, or if he is found in his hand, he shall surely be put to death.

name: Exodus 21:17
text: "Anyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

name: Exodus 21:18
text: "If men quarrel and one strikes the other with a stone, or with his fist, and he doesn"t die, but is confined to bed;

name: Exodus 21:19
text: if he rises again and walks around with his staff, then he who struck him shall be cleared: only he shall pay for the loss of his time, and shall provide for his healing until he is thoroughly healed.

name: Exodus 21:20
text: "If a man strikes his servant or his maid with a rod, and he dies under his hand, he shall surely be punished.

name: Exodus 21:21
text: Notwithstanding, if he gets up after a day or two, he shall not be punished, for he is his property.

name: Exodus 21:22
text: "If men fight and hurt a pregnant woman so that she gives birth prematurely, and yet no harm follows, he shall be surely fined as much as the woman"s husband demands and the judges allow.

name: Exodus 21:23
text: But if any harm follows, then you must take life for life,

name: Exodus 21:24
text: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,

name: Exodus 21:25
text: burning for burning, wound for wound, and bruise for bruise.

name: Exodus 21:26
text: "If a man strikes his servant"s eye, or his maid"s eye, and destroys it, he shall let him go free for his eye"s sake.

name: Exodus 21:27
text: If he strikes out his male servant"s tooth, or his female servant"s tooth, he shall let him go free for his tooth"s sake.

name: Exodus 21:28
text: "If a bull gores a man or a woman to death, the bull shall surely be stoned, and its flesh shall not be eaten; but the owner of the bull shall not be held responsible.

name: Exodus 21:29
text: But if the bull had a habit of goring in the past, and it has been testified to its owner, and he has not kept it in, but it has killed a man or a woman, the bull shall be stoned, and its owner shall also be put to death.

name: Exodus 21:30
text: If a ransom is laid on him, then he shall give for the redemption of his life whatever is laid on him.

name: Exodus 21:31
text: Whether it has gored a son or has gored a daughter, according to this judgment it shall be done to him.

name: Exodus 21:32
text: If the bull gores a male servant or a female servant, thirty shekels of silver shall be given to their master, and the ox shall be stoned.

name: Exodus 21:33
text: "If a man opens a pit, or if a man digs a pit and doesn"t cover it, and a bull or a donkey falls into it,

name: Exodus 21:34
text: the owner of the pit shall make it good. He shall give money to its owner, and the dead animal shall be his.

name: Exodus 21:35
text: "If one man"s bull injures another"s, so that it dies, then they shall sell the live bull, and divide its price; and they shall also divide the dead animal.

name: Exodus 21:36
text: Or if it is known that the bull was in the habit of goring in the past, and its owner has not kept it in, he shall surely pay bull for bull, and the dead animal shall be his own.

name: Exodus 22:1
text: "If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it, or sells it; he shall pay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep.

name: Exodus 22:2
text: If the thief is found breaking in, and is struck so that he dies, there shall be no guilt of bloodshed for him.

name: Exodus 22:3
text: If the sun has risen on him, guilt of bloodshed shall be for him; he shall make restitution. If he has nothing, then he shall be sold for his theft.

name: Exodus 22:4
text: If the stolen property is found in his hand alive, whether it is ox, donkey, or sheep, he shall pay double.

name: Exodus 22:5
text: "If a man causes a field or vineyard to be eaten, and lets his animal loose, and it grazes in another man"s field, he shall make restitution from the best of his own field, and from the best of his own vineyard.

name: Exodus 22:6
text: "If fire breaks out, and catches in thorns so that the shocks of grain, or the standing grain, or the field are consumed; he who kindled the fire shall surely make restitution.

name: Exodus 22:7
text: "If a man delivers to his neighbor money or stuff to keep, and it is stolen out of the man"s house; if the thief is found, he shall pay double.

name: Exodus 22:8
text: If the thief isn"t found, then the master of the house shall come near to God, to find out if he hasn"t put his hand to his neighbor"s goods.

name: Exodus 22:9
text: For every matter of trespass, whether it be for ox, for donkey, for sheep, for clothing, or for any kind of lost thing, about which one says, "This is mine," the cause of both parties shall come before God. He whom God condemns shall pay double to his neighbor.

name: Exodus 22:10
text: "If a man delivers to his neighbor a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any animal to keep, and it dies or is injured, or driven away, no man seeing it;

name: Exodus 22:11
text: the oath of Yahweh shall be between them both, whether he hasn"t put his hand to his neighbor"s goods; and its owner shall accept it, and he shall not make restitution.

name: Exodus 22:12
text: But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to its owner.

name: Exodus 22:13
text: If it is torn in pieces, let him bring it for evidence. He shall not make good that which was torn.

name: Exodus 22:14
text: "If a man borrows anything of his neighbor"s, and it is injured, or dies, its owner not being with it, he shall surely make restitution.

name: Exodus 22:15
text: If its owner is with it, he shall not make it good. If it is a leased thing, it came for its lease.

name: Exodus 22:16
text: "If a man entices a virgin who isn"t pledged to be married, and lies with her, he shall surely pay a dowry for her to be his wife.

name: Exodus 22:17
text: If her father utterly refuses to give her to him, he shall pay money according to the dowry of virgins.

name: Exodus 22:18
text: "You shall not allow a sorceress to live.

name: Exodus 22:19
text: "Whoever has sex with an animal shall surely be put to death.

name: Exodus 22:20
text: "He who sacrifices to any god, except to Yahweh only, shall be utterly destroyed.

name: Exodus 22:21
text: "You shall not wrong an alien, neither shall you oppress him, for you were aliens in the land of Egypt.

name: Exodus 22:22
text: "You shall not take advantage of any widow or fatherless child.

name: Exodus 22:23
text: If you take advantage of them at all, and they cry at all to me, I will surely hear their cry;

name: Exodus 22:24
text: and my wrath will grow hot, and I will kill you with the sword; and your wives shall be widows, and your children fatherless.

name: Exodus 22:25
text: "If you lend money to any of my people with you who is poor, you shall not be to him as a creditor; neither shall you charge him interest.

name: Exodus 22:26
text: If you take your neighbor"s garment as collateral, you shall restore it to him before the sun goes down,

name: Exodus 22:27
text: for that is his only covering, it is his garment for his skin. What would he sleep in? It will happen, when he cries to me, that I will hear, for I am gracious.

name: Exodus 22:28
text: "You shall not blaspheme God, nor curse a ruler of your people.

name: Exodus 22:29
text: "You shall not delay to offer from your harvest and from the outflow of your presses. "You shall give the firstborn of your sons to me.

name: Exodus 22:30
text: You shall do likewise with your cattle and with your sheep. Seven days it shall be with its mother, then on the eighth day you shall give it to me.

name: Exodus 22:31
text: "You shall be holy men to me, therefore you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by animals in the field. You shall cast it to the dogs.

name: Exodus 23:1
text: "You shall not spread a false report. Don"t join your hand with the wicked to be a malicious witness.

name: Exodus 23:2
text: "You shall not follow a crowd to do evil; neither shall you testify in court to side with a multitude to pervert justice;

name: Exodus 23:3
text: neither shall you favor a poor man in his cause.

name: Exodus 23:4
text: "If you meet your enemy"s ox or his donkey going astray, you shall surely bring it back to him again.

name: Exodus 23:5
text: If you see the donkey of him who hates you fallen down under his burden, don"t leave him, you shall surely help him with it.

name: Exodus 23:6
text: "You shall not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits.

name: Exodus 23:7
text: "Keep far from a false charge, and don"t kill the innocent and righteous: for I will not justify the wicked.

name: Exodus 23:8
text: "You shall take no bribe, for a bribe blinds those who have sight and perverts the words of the righteous.

name: Exodus 23:9
text: "You shall not oppress an alien, for you know the heart of an alien, since you were aliens in the land of Egypt.

name: Exodus 23:10
text: "For six years you shall sow your land, and shall gather in its increase,

name: Exodus 23:11
text: but the seventh year you shall let it rest and lie fallow, that the poor of your people may eat; and what they leave the animal of the field shall eat. In the same way, you shall deal with your vineyard and with your olive grove.

name: Exodus 23:12
text: "Six days you shall do your work, and on the seventh day you shall rest, that your ox and your donkey may have rest, and the son of your handmaid, and the alien may be refreshed.

name: Exodus 23:13
text: "Be careful to do all things that I have said to you; and don"t invoke the name of other gods, neither let them be heard out of your mouth.

name: Exodus 23:14
text: "You shall observe a feast to me three times a year.

name: Exodus 23:15
text: You shall observe the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib (for in it you came out from Egypt), and no one shall appear before me empty.

name: Exodus 23:16
text: And the feast of harvest, the first fruits of your labors, which you sow in the field: and the feast of harvest, at the end of the year, when you gather in your labors out of the field.

name: Exodus 23:17
text: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord Yahweh.

name: Exodus 23:18
text: "You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread, neither shall the fat of my feast remain all night until the morning.

name: Exodus 23:19
text: The first of the first fruits of your ground you shall bring into the house of Yahweh your God. "You shall not boil a young goat in its mother"s milk.

name: Exodus 23:20
text: "Behold, I send an angel before you, to keep you by the way, and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.

name: Exodus 23:21
text: Pay attention to him, and listen to his voice. Don"t provoke him, for he will not pardon your disobedience, for my name is in him.

name: Exodus 23:22
text: But if you indeed listen to his voice, and do all that I speak, then I will be an enemy to your enemies, and an adversary to your adversaries.

name: Exodus 23:23
text: For my angel shall go before you, and bring you in to the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I will cut them off.

name: Exodus 23:24
text: You shall not bow down to their gods, nor serve them, nor follow their practices, but you shall utterly overthrow them and demolish their pillars.

name: Exodus 23:25
text: You shall serve Yahweh your God, and he will bless your bread and your water, and I will take sickness away from your midst.

name: Exodus 23:26
text: No one will miscarry or be barren in your land. I will fulfill the number of your days.

name: Exodus 23:27
text: I will send my terror before you, and will confuse all the people to whom you come, and I will make all your enemies turn their backs to you.

name: Exodus 23:28
text: I will send the hornet before you, which will drive out the Hivite, the Canaanite, and the Hittite, from before you.

name: Exodus 23:29
text: I will not drive them out from before you in one year, lest the land become desolate, and the animals of the field multiply against you.

name: Exodus 23:30
text: Little by little I will drive them out from before you, until you have increased and inherit the land.

name: Exodus 23:31
text: I will set your border from the Red Sea even to the sea of the Philistines, and from the wilderness to the River; for I will deliver the inhabitants of the land into your hand, and you shall drive them out before you.

name: Exodus 23:32
text: You shall make no covenant with them, nor with their gods.

name: Exodus 23:33
text: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me, for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you."

name: Exodus 24:1
text: He said to Moses, "Come up to Yahweh, you, and Aaron, Nadab, and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel; and worship from a distance.

name: Exodus 24:2
text: Moses alone shall come near to Yahweh, but they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him."

name: Exodus 24:3
text: Moses came and told the people all the words of Yahweh, and all the ordinances; and all the people answered with one voice, and said, "All the words which Yahweh has spoken will we do."

name: Exodus 24:4
text: Moses wrote all the words of Yahweh, and rose up early in the morning, and built an altar under the mountain, and twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.

name: Exodus 24:5
text: He sent young men of the children of Israel, who offered burnt offerings and sacrificed peace offerings of cattle to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 24:6
text: Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins, and half of the blood he sprinkled on the altar.

name: Exodus 24:7
text: He took the book of the covenant and read it in the hearing of the people, and they said, "All that Yahweh has spoken will we do, and be obedient."

name: Exodus 24:8
text: Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, "Look, this is the blood of the covenant, which Yahweh has made with you concerning all these words."

name: Exodus 24:9
text: Then Moses, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel went up.

name: Exodus 24:10
text: They saw the God of Israel. Under his feet was like a paved work of sapphire stone, like the skies for clearness.

name: Exodus 24:11
text: He didn"t lay his hand on the nobles of the children of Israel. They saw God, and ate and drank.

name: Exodus 24:12
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Come up to me on the mountain, and stay here, and I will give you the tables of stone with the law and the commands that I have written, that you may teach them."

name: Exodus 24:13
text: Moses rose up with Joshua, his servant, and Moses went up onto God"s Mountain.

name: Exodus 24:14
text: He said to the elders, "Wait here for us, until we come again to you. Behold, Aaron and Hur are with you. Whoever is involved in a dispute can go to them."

name: Exodus 24:15
text: Moses went up on the mountain, and the cloud covered the mountain.

name: Exodus 24:16
text: The glory of Yahweh settled on Mount Sinai, and the cloud covered it six days. The seventh day he called to Moses out of the midst of the cloud.

name: Exodus 24:17
text: The appearance of the glory of Yahweh was like devouring fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the children of Israel.

name: Exodus 24:18
text: Moses entered into the midst of the cloud, and went up on the mountain; and Moses was on the mountain forty days and forty nights.

name: Exodus 25:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 25:2
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, that they take an offering for me. From everyone whose heart makes him willing you shall take my offering.

name: Exodus 25:3
text: This is the offering which you shall take from them: gold, silver, brass,

name: Exodus 25:4
text: blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats" hair,

name: Exodus 25:5
text: rams" skins dyed red, sea cow hides, acacia wood,

name: Exodus 25:6
text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,

name: Exodus 25:7
text: onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.

name: Exodus 25:8
text: Let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.

name: Exodus 25:9
text: According to all that I show you, the pattern of the tabernacle, and the pattern of all of its furniture, even so you shall make it.

name: Exodus 25:10
text: "They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Its length shall be two and a half cubits, its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.

name: Exodus 25:11
text: You shall overlay it with pure gold. You shall overlay it inside and outside, and you shall make a gold molding around it.

name: Exodus 25:12
text: You shall cast four rings of gold for it, and put them in its four feet. Two rings shall be on the one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.

name: Exodus 25:13
text: You shall make poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

name: Exodus 25:14
text: You shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark.

name: Exodus 25:15
text: The poles shall be in the rings of the ark. They shall not be taken from it.

name: Exodus 25:16
text: You shall put the testimony which I shall give you into the ark.

name: Exodus 25:17
text: You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold. Two and a half cubits shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its breadth.

name: Exodus 25:18
text: You shall make two cherubim of hammered gold. You shall make them at the two ends of the mercy seat.

name: Exodus 25:19
text: Make one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end. You shall make the cherubim on its two ends of one piece with the mercy seat.

name: Exodus 25:20
text: The cherubim shall spread out their wings upward, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim shall be toward the mercy seat.

name: Exodus 25:21
text: You shall put the mercy seat on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony that I will give you.

name: Exodus 25:22
text: There I will meet with you, and I will tell you from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim which are on the ark of the testimony, all that I command you for the children of Israel.

name: Exodus 25:23
text: "You shall make a table of acacia wood. Two cubits shall be its length, and a cubit its breadth, and one and a half cubits its height.

name: Exodus 25:24
text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.

name: Exodus 25:25
text: You shall make a rim of a handbreadth around it. You shall make a golden molding on its rim around it.

name: Exodus 25:26
text: You shall make four rings of gold for it, and put the rings in the four corners that are on its four feet.

name: Exodus 25:27
text: the rings shall be close to the rim, for places for the poles to carry the table.

name: Exodus 25:28
text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold, that the table may be carried with them.

name: Exodus 25:29
text: You shall make its dishes, its spoons, its ladles, and its bowls to pour out offerings with. You shall make them of pure gold.

name: Exodus 25:30
text: You shall set bread of the presence on the table before me always.

name: Exodus 25:31
text: "You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. Of hammered work shall the lampstand be made, even its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers, shall be of one piece with it.

name: Exodus 25:32
text: There shall be six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of its one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of its other side;

name: Exodus 25:33
text: three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower; and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower, so for the six branches going out of the lampstand;

name: Exodus 25:34
text: and in the lampstand four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers;

name: Exodus 25:35
text: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of the lampstand.

name: Exodus 25:36
text: Their buds and their branches shall be of one piece with it, all of it one beaten work of pure gold.

name: Exodus 25:37
text: You shall make its lamps seven, and they shall light its lamps to give light to the space in front of it.

name: Exodus 25:38
text: Its snuffers and its snuff dishes shall be of pure gold.

name: Exodus 25:39
text: It shall be made of a talent of pure gold, with all these accessories.

name: Exodus 25:40
text: See that you make them after their pattern, which has been shown to you on the mountain.

name: Exodus 26:1
text: "Moreover you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, with cherubim. The work of the skillful workman you shall make them.

name: Exodus 26:2
text: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains shall have one measure.

name: Exodus 26:3
text: Five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.

name: Exodus 26:4
text: You shall make loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain from the edge in the coupling; and likewise you shall make in the edge of the curtain that is outmost in the second coupling.

name: Exodus 26:5
text: You shall make fifty loops in the one curtain, and you shall make fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that is in the second coupling. The loops shall be opposite one to another.

name: Exodus 26:6
text: You shall make fifty clasps of gold, and couple the curtains one to another with the clasps: and the tabernacle shall be a unit.

name: Exodus 26:7
text: "You shall make curtains of goats" hair for a covering over the tabernacle. You shall make them eleven curtains.

name: Exodus 26:8
text: The length of each curtain shall be thirty cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: the eleven curtains shall have one measure.

name: Exodus 26:9
text: You shall couple five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves, and shall double over the sixth curtain in the forefront of the tent.

name: Exodus 26:10
text: You shall make fifty loops on the edge of the one curtain that is outmost in the coupling, and fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which is outmost in the second coupling.

name: Exodus 26:11
text: You shall make fifty clasps of brass, and put the clasps into the loops, and couple the tent together, that it may be one.

name: Exodus 26:12
text: The overhanging part that remains of the curtains of the tent, the half curtain that remains, shall hang over the back of the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 26:13
text: The cubit on the one side, and the cubit on the other side, of that which remains in the length of the curtains of the tent, shall hang over the sides of the tabernacle on this side and on that side, to cover it.

name: Exodus 26:14
text: You shall make a covering for the tent of rams" skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.

name: Exodus 26:15
text: "You shall make the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.

name: Exodus 26:16
text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and one and a half cubits the breadth of each board.

name: Exodus 26:17
text: There shall be two tenons in each board, joined to one another: thus you shall make for all the boards of the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 26:18
text: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.

name: Exodus 26:19
text: You shall make forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.

name: Exodus 26:20
text: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, twenty boards,

name: Exodus 26:21
text: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

name: Exodus 26:22
text: For the far part of the tabernacle westward you shall make six boards.

name: Exodus 26:23
text: You shall make two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part.

name: Exodus 26:24
text: They shall be double beneath, and in the same way they shall be whole to its top to one ring: thus shall it be for them both; they shall be for the two corners.

name: Exodus 26:25
text: There shall be eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

name: Exodus 26:26
text: "You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,

name: Exodus 26:27
text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the side of the tabernacle, for the far part westward.

name: Exodus 26:28
text: The middle bar in the midst of the boards shall pass through from end to end.

name: Exodus 26:29
text: You shall overlay the boards with gold, and make their rings of gold for places for the bars: and you shall overlay the bars with gold.

name: Exodus 26:30
text: You shall set up the tabernacle according to the way that it was shown to you on the mountain.

name: Exodus 26:31
text: "You shall make a veil of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cherubim. The work of the skillful workman shall it be made.

name: Exodus 26:32
text: You shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold; their hooks shall be of gold, on four sockets of silver.

name: Exodus 26:33
text: You shall hang up the veil under the clasps, and shall bring the ark of the testimony in there within the veil: and the veil shall separate the holy place from the most holy for you.

name: Exodus 26:34
text: You shall put the mercy seat on the ark of the testimony in the most holy place.

name: Exodus 26:35
text: You shall set the table outside the veil, and the lampstand over against the table on the side of the tabernacle toward the south: and you shall put the table on the north side.

name: Exodus 26:36
text: "You shall make a screen for the door of the Tent, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer.

name: Exodus 26:37
text: You shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia, and overlay them with gold: their hooks shall be of gold: and you shall cast five sockets of brass for them.

name: Exodus 27:1
text: "You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and its height shall be three cubits.

name: Exodus 27:2
text: You shall make its horns on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it; and you shall overlay it with brass.

name: Exodus 27:3
text: You shall make its pots to take away its ashes, its shovels, its basins, its flesh hooks, and its fire pans: all its vessels you shall make of brass.

name: Exodus 27:4
text: You shall make a grating for it of network of brass: and on the net you shall make four bronze rings in its four corners.

name: Exodus 27:5
text: You shall put it under the ledge around the altar beneath, that the net may reach halfway up the altar.

name: Exodus 27:6
text: You shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with brass.

name: Exodus 27:7
text: Its poles shall be put into the rings, and the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar, when carrying it.

name: Exodus 27:8
text: You shall make it with hollow planks. They shall make it as it has been shown you on the mountain.

name: Exodus 27:9
text: "You shall make the court of the tabernacle: for the south side southward there shall be hangings for the court of fine twined linen one hundred cubits long for one side:

name: Exodus 27:10
text: and its pillars shall be twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets shall be of silver.

name: Exodus 27:11
text: Likewise for the north side in length there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, and its pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

name: Exodus 27:12
text: For the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits; their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.

name: Exodus 27:13
text: The breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.

name: Exodus 27:14
text: The hangings for the one side of the gate shall be fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

name: Exodus 27:15
text: For the other side shall be hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

name: Exodus 27:16
text: For the gate of the court shall be a screen of twenty cubits, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the embroiderer; their pillars four, and their sockets four.

name: Exodus 27:17
text: All the pillars of the court around shall be filleted with silver; their hooks of silver, and their sockets of brass.

name: Exodus 27:18
text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, and the breadth fifty every where, and the height five cubits, of fine twined linen, and their sockets of brass.

name: Exodus 27:19
text: All the instruments of the tabernacle in all its service, and all its pins, and all the pins of the court, shall be of brass.

name: Exodus 27:20
text: "You shall command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

name: Exodus 27:21
text: In the Tent of Meeting, outside the veil which is before the testimony, Aaron and his sons shall keep it in order from evening to morning before Yahweh: it shall be a statute forever throughout their generations on the behalf of the children of Israel.

name: Exodus 28:1
text: "Bring Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, near to you from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to me in the priest"s office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron"s sons.

name: Exodus 28:2
text: You shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.

name: Exodus 28:3
text: You shall speak to all who are wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron"s garments to sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 28:4
text: These are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a coat of checker work, a turban, and a sash: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, and his sons, that he may minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 28:5
text: They shall take the gold, and the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, and the fine linen.

name: Exodus 28:6
text: "They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the skillful workman.

name: Exodus 28:7
text: It shall have two shoulder straps joined to the two ends of it, that it may be joined together.

name: Exodus 28:8
text: The skillfully woven band, which is on it, that is on him, shall be like its work and of the same piece; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.

name: Exodus 28:9
text: You shall take two onyx stones, and engrave on them the names of the children of Israel:

name: Exodus 28:10
text: six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the six that remain on the other stone, in the order of their birth.

name: Exodus 28:11
text: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, you shall engrave the two stones, according to the names of the children of Israel: you shall make them to be enclosed in settings of gold.

name: Exodus 28:12
text: You shall put the two stones on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before Yahweh on his two shoulders for a memorial.

name: Exodus 28:13
text: You shall make settings of gold,

name: Exodus 28:14
text: and two chains of pure gold; you shall make them like cords of braided work: and you shall put the braided chains on the settings.

name: Exodus 28:15
text: "You shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skillful workman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, you shall make it.

name: Exodus 28:16
text: It shall be square and folded double; a span shall be its length of it, and a span its breadth.

name: Exodus 28:17
text: You shall set in it settings of stones, four rows of stones: a row of ruby, topaz, and beryl shall be the first row;

name: Exodus 28:18
text: and the second row a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;

name: Exodus 28:19
text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

name: Exodus 28:20
text: and the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.

name: Exodus 28:21
text: The stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, they shall be for the twelve tribes.

name: Exodus 28:22
text: You shall make on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold.

name: Exodus 28:23
text: You shall make on the breastplate two rings of gold, and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.

name: Exodus 28:24
text: You shall put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.

name: Exodus 28:25
text: The other two ends of the two braided chains you shall put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in its forepart.

name: Exodus 28:26
text: You shall make two rings of gold, and you shall put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which is toward the side of the ephod inward.

name: Exodus 28:27
text: You shall make two rings of gold, and shall put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its forepart, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.

name: Exodus 28:28
text: They shall bind the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate may not swing out from the ephod.

name: Exodus 28:29
text: Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment on his heart, when he goes in to the holy place, for a memorial before Yahweh continually.

name: Exodus 28:30
text: You shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be on Aaron"s heart, when he goes in before Yahweh: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel on his heart before Yahweh continually.

name: Exodus 28:31
text: "You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.

name: Exodus 28:32
text: It shall have a hole for the head in its midst: it shall have a binding of woven work around its hole, as it were the hole of a coat of mail, that it not be torn.

name: Exodus 28:33
text: On its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, around its hem; and bells of gold between and around them:

name: Exodus 28:34
text: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe.

name: Exodus 28:35
text: It shall be on Aaron to minister: and its sound shall be heard when he goes in to the holy place before Yahweh, and when he comes out, that he not die.

name: Exodus 28:36
text: "You shall make a plate of pure gold, and engrave on it, like the engravings of a signet, "HOLY TO YAHWEH."

name: Exodus 28:37
text: You shall put it on a lace of blue, and it shall be on the sash; on the front of the sash it shall be.

name: Exodus 28:38
text: It shall be on Aaron"s forehead, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall make holy in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always on his forehead, that they may be accepted before Yahweh.

name: Exodus 28:39
text: You shall weave the coat in checker work of fine linen, and you shall make a turban of fine linen, and you shall make a sash, the work of the embroiderer.

name: Exodus 28:40
text: "You shall make coats for Aaron"s sons, and you shall make sashes for them and you shall make headbands for them, for glory and for beauty.

name: Exodus 28:41
text: You shall put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and shall anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 28:42
text: You shall make them linen breeches to cover the flesh of their nakedness; from the waist even to the thighs they shall reach:

name: Exodus 28:43
text: They shall be on Aaron, and on his sons, when they go in to the Tent of Meeting, or when they come near to the altar to minister in the holy place; that they don"t bear iniquity, and die: it shall be a statute forever to him and to his descendants after him.

name: Exodus 29:1
text: "This is the thing that you shall do to them to make them holy, to minister to me in the priest"s office: take one young bull and two rams without blemish,

name: Exodus 29:2
text: unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil: you shall make them of fine wheat flour.

name: Exodus 29:3
text: You shall put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bull and the two rams.

name: Exodus 29:4
text: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall wash them with water.

name: Exodus 29:5
text: You shall take the garments, and put on Aaron the coat, the robe of the ephod, the ephod, and the breastplate, and clothe him with the skillfully woven band of the ephod;

name: Exodus 29:6
text: and you shall set the turban on his head, and put the holy crown on the turban.

name: Exodus 29:7
text: Then you shall take the anointing oil, and pour it on his head, and anoint him.

name: Exodus 29:8
text: You shall bring his sons, and put coats on them.

name: Exodus 29:9
text: You shall clothe them with belts, Aaron and his sons, and bind headbands on them: and they shall have the priesthood by a perpetual statute: and you shall consecrate Aaron and his sons.

name: Exodus 29:10
text: "You shall bring the bull before the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull.

name: Exodus 29:11
text: You shall kill the bull before Yahweh, at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Exodus 29:12
text: You shall take of the blood of the bull, and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; and you shall pour out all the blood at the base of the altar.

name: Exodus 29:13
text: You shall take all the fat that covers the innards, the cover of the liver, the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, and burn them on the altar.

name: Exodus 29:14
text: But the flesh of the bull, and its skin, and its dung, you shall burn with fire outside of the camp: it is a sin offering.

name: Exodus 29:15
text: "You shall also take the one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram.

name: Exodus 29:16
text: You shall kill the ram, and you shall take its blood, and sprinkle it around on the altar.

name: Exodus 29:17
text: You shall cut the ram into its pieces, and wash its innards, and its legs, and put them with its pieces, and with its head.

name: Exodus 29:18
text: You shall burn the whole ram on the altar: it is a burnt offering to Yahweh; it is a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:19
text: "You shall take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram.

name: Exodus 29:20
text: Then you shall kill the ram, and take some of its blood, and put it on the tip of the right ear of Aaron, and on the tip of the right ear of his sons, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the big toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood around on the altar.

name: Exodus 29:21
text: You shall take of the blood that is on the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle it on Aaron, and on his garments, and on his sons, and on the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be made holy, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons" garments with him.

name: Exodus 29:22
text: Also you shall take some of the ram"s fat, the fat tail, the fat that covers the innards, the cover of the liver, the two kidneys, the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),

name: Exodus 29:23
text: and one loaf of bread, one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:24
text: You shall put all of this in Aaron"s hands, and in his sons" hands, and shall wave them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:25
text: You shall take them from their hands, and burn them on the altar on the burnt offering, for a pleasant aroma before Yahweh: it is an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:26
text: "You shall take the breast of Aaron"s ram of consecration, and wave it for a wave offering before Yahweh: and it shall be your portion.

name: Exodus 29:27
text: You shall sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the thigh of the wave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of consecration, even of that which is for Aaron, and of that which is for his sons:

name: Exodus 29:28
text: and it shall be for Aaron and his sons as their portion forever from the children of Israel; for it is a wave offering: and it shall be a wave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, even their wave offering to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:29
text: "The holy garments of Aaron shall be for his sons after him, to be anointed in them, and to be consecrated in them.

name: Exodus 29:30
text: Seven days shall the son who is priest in his place put them on, when he comes into the Tent of Meeting to minister in the holy place.

name: Exodus 29:31
text: "You shall take the ram of consecration, and boil its flesh in a holy place.

name: Exodus 29:32
text: Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that is in the basket, at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Exodus 29:33
text: They shall eat those things with which atonement was made, to consecrate and sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat of it, because they are holy.

name: Exodus 29:34
text: If anything of the flesh of the consecration, or of the bread, remains to the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.

name: Exodus 29:35
text: "You shall do so to Aaron, and to his sons, according to all that I have commanded you. You shall consecrate them seven days.

name: Exodus 29:36
text: Every day you shall offer the bull of sin offering for atonement: and you shall cleanse the altar, when you make atonement for it; and you shall anoint it, to sanctify it.

name: Exodus 29:37
text: Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar, and sanctify it: and the altar shall be most holy; whatever touches the altar shall be holy.

name: Exodus 29:38
text: "Now this is that which you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old day by day continually.

name: Exodus 29:39
text: The one lamb you shall offer in the morning; and the other lamb you shall offer at evening:

name: Exodus 29:40
text: and with the one lamb a tenth part of an ephah of fine flour mixed with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil, and the fourth part of a hin of wine for a drink offering.

name: Exodus 29:41
text: The other lamb you shall offer at evening, and shall do to it according to the meal offering of the morning, and according to its drink offering, for a pleasant aroma, an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 29:42
text: It shall be a continual burnt offering throughout your generations at the door of the Tent of Meeting before Yahweh, where I will meet with you, to speak there to you.

name: Exodus 29:43
text: There I will meet with the children of Israel; and the place shall be sanctified by my glory.

name: Exodus 29:44
text: I will sanctify the Tent of Meeting and the altar: Aaron also and his sons I will sanctify, to minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 29:45
text: I will dwell among the children of Israel, and will be their God.

name: Exodus 29:46
text: They shall know that I am Yahweh their God, who brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I might dwell among them: I am Yahweh their God.

name: Exodus 30:1
text: "You shall make an altar to burn incense on. You shall make it of acacia wood.

name: Exodus 30:2
text: Its length shall be a cubit, and its breadth a cubit. It shall be square, and its height shall be two cubits. Its horns shall be of one piece with it.

name: Exodus 30:3
text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns; and you shall make a gold molding around it.

name: Exodus 30:4
text: You shall make two golden rings for it under its molding; on its two ribs, on its two sides you shall make them; and they shall be for places for poles with which to bear it.

name: Exodus 30:5
text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

name: Exodus 30:6
text: You shall put it before the veil that is by the ark of the testimony, before the mercy seat that is over the testimony, where I will meet with you.

name: Exodus 30:7
text: Aaron shall burn incense of sweet spices on it every morning. When he tends the lamps, he shall burn it.

name: Exodus 30:8
text: When Aaron lights the lamps at evening, he shall burn it, a perpetual incense before Yahweh throughout your generations.

name: Exodus 30:9
text: You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it.

name: Exodus 30:10
text: Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once in the year; with the blood of the sin offering of atonement once in the year he shall make atonement for it throughout your generations. It is most holy to Yahweh."

name: Exodus 30:11
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 30:12
text: "When you take a census of the children of Israel, according to those who are numbered among them, then each man shall give a ransom for his soul to Yahweh, when you number them; that there be no plague among them when you number them.

name: Exodus 30:13
text: They shall give this, everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, half a shekel after the shekel of the sanctuary; (the shekel is twenty gerahs;) half a shekel for an offering to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 30:14
text: Everyone who passes over to those who are numbered, from twenty years old and upward, shall give the offering to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 30:15
text: The rich shall not give more, and the poor shall not give less, than the half shekel, when they give the offering of Yahweh, to make atonement for your souls.

name: Exodus 30:16
text: You shall take the atonement money from the children of Israel, and shall appoint it for the service of the Tent of Meeting; that it may be a memorial for the children of Israel before Yahweh, to make atonement for your souls."

name: Exodus 30:17
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 30:18
text: "You shall also make a basin of brass, and its base of brass, in which to wash. You shall put it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it.

name: Exodus 30:19
text: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in it.

name: Exodus 30:20
text: When they go into the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 30:21
text: So they shall wash their hands and their feet, that they not die: and it shall be a statute forever to them, even to him and to his descendants throughout their generations."

name: Exodus 30:22
text: Moreover Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 30:23
text: "Also take fine spices: of liquid myrrh, five hundred shekels; and of fragrant cinnamon half as much, even two hundred and fifty; and of fragrant cane, two hundred and fifty;

name: Exodus 30:24
text: and of cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the sanctuary; and a hin of olive oil.

name: Exodus 30:25
text: You shall make it a holy anointing oil, a perfume compounded after the art of the perfumer: it shall be a holy anointing oil.

name: Exodus 30:26
text: You shall use it to anoint the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the testimony,

name: Exodus 30:27
text: the table and all its articles, the lampstand and its accessories, the altar of incense,

name: Exodus 30:28
text: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its base.

name: Exodus 30:29
text: You shall sanctify them, that they may be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy.

name: Exodus 30:30
text: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 30:31
text: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, "This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.

name: Exodus 30:32
text: It shall not be poured on man"s flesh, neither shall you make any like it, according to its composition: it is holy. It shall be holy to you.

name: Exodus 30:33
text: Whoever compounds any like it, or whoever puts any of it on a stranger, he shall be cut off from his people.""

name: Exodus 30:34
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Take to yourself sweet spices, gum resin, and onycha, and galbanum; sweet spices with pure frankincense: there shall be an equal weight of each;

name: Exodus 30:35
text: and you shall make incense of it, a perfume after the art of the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy:

name: Exodus 30:36
text: and you shall beat some of it very small, and put some of it before the testimony in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be to you most holy.

name: Exodus 30:37
text: The incense which you shall make, according to its composition you shall not make for yourselves: it shall be to you holy for Yahweh.

name: Exodus 30:38
text: Whoever shall make any like that, to smell of it, he shall be cut off from his people."

name: Exodus 31:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 31:2
text: "Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:

name: Exodus 31:3
text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all kinds of workmanship,

name: Exodus 31:4
text: to devise skillful works, to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass,

name: Exodus 31:5
text: and in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of workmanship.

name: Exodus 31:6
text: I, behold, I have appointed with him Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan; and in the heart of all who are wise-hearted I have put wisdom, that they may make all that I have commanded you:

name: Exodus 31:7
text: the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the testimony, the mercy seat that is on it, all the furniture of the Tent,

name: Exodus 31:8
text: the table and its vessels, the pure lampstand with all its vessels, the altar of incense,

name: Exodus 31:9
text: the altar of burnt offering with all its vessels, the basin and its base,

name: Exodus 31:10
text: the finely worked garments"the holy garments for Aaron the priest"the garments of his sons to minister in the priest"s office,

name: Exodus 31:11
text: the anointing oil, and the incense of sweet spices for the holy place: according to all that I have commanded you they shall do."

name: Exodus 31:12
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 31:13
text: "Speak also to the children of Israel, saying, "Most certainly you shall keep my Sabbaths: for it is a sign between me and you throughout your generations; that you may know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies you.

name: Exodus 31:14
text: You shall keep the Sabbath therefore; for it is holy to you. Everyone who profanes it shall surely be put to death; for whoever does any work therein, that soul shall be cut off from among his people.

name: Exodus 31:15
text: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to Yahweh. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall surely be put to death.

name: Exodus 31:16
text: Therefore the children of Israel shall keep the Sabbath, to observe the Sabbath throughout their generations, for a perpetual covenant.

name: Exodus 31:17
text: It is a sign between me and the children of Israel forever; for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested, and was refreshed.""

name: Exodus 31:18
text: He gave to Moses, when he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets, written with God"s finger.

name: Exodus 32:1
text: When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron, and said to him, "Come, make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don"t know what has become of him."

name: Exodus 32:2
text: Aaron said to them, "Take off the golden rings, which are in the ears of your wives, of your sons, and of your daughters, and bring them to me."

name: Exodus 32:3
text: All the people took off the golden rings which were in their ears, and brought them to Aaron.

name: Exodus 32:4
text: He received what they handed him, and fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it a molten calf; and they said, "These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt."

name: Exodus 32:5
text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it; and Aaron made a proclamation, and said, "Tomorrow shall be a feast to Yahweh."

name: Exodus 32:6
text: They rose up early on the next day, and offered burnt offerings, and brought peace offerings; and the people sat down to eat and to drink, and rose up to play.

name: Exodus 32:7
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, "Go, get down; for your people, who you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves!

name: Exodus 32:8
text: They have turned aside quickly out of the way which I commanded them. They have made themselves a molten calf, and have worshiped it, and have sacrificed to it, and said, "These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.""

name: Exodus 32:9
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "I have seen these people, and behold, they are a stiff-necked people.

name: Exodus 32:10
text: Now therefore leave me alone, that my wrath may burn hot against them, and that I may consume them; and I will make of you a great nation."

name: Exodus 32:11
text: Moses begged Yahweh his God, and said, "Yahweh, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, that you have brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?

name: Exodus 32:12
text: Why should the Egyptians speak, saying, "He brought them forth for evil, to kill them in the mountains, and to consume them from the surface of the earth?" Turn from your fierce wrath, and repent of this evil against your people.

name: Exodus 32:13
text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your own self, and said to them, "I will multiply your seed as the stars of the sky, and all this land that I have spoken of I will give to your seed, and they shall inherit it forever.""

name: Exodus 32:14
text: Yahweh repented of the evil which he said he would do to his people.

name: Exodus 32:15
text: Moses turned, and went down from the mountain, with the two tablets of the testimony in his hand; tablets that were written on both their sides; on the one side and on the other they were written.

name: Exodus 32:16
text: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tables.

name: Exodus 32:17
text: When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, "There is the noise of war in the camp."

name: Exodus 32:18
text: He said, "It isn"t the voice of those who shout for victory, neither is it the voice of those who cry for being overcome; but the noise of those who sing that I hear."

name: Exodus 32:19
text: It happened, as soon as he came near to the camp, that he saw the calf and the dancing: and Moses" anger grew hot, and he threw the tablets out of his hands, and broke them beneath the mountain.

name: Exodus 32:20
text: He took the calf which they had made, and burnt it with fire, ground it to powder, and scattered it on the water, and made the children of Israel drink of it.

name: Exodus 32:21
text: Moses said to Aaron, "What did these people do to you, that you have brought a great sin on them?"

name: Exodus 32:22
text: Aaron said, "Don"t let the anger of my lord grow hot. You know the people, that they are set on evil.

name: Exodus 32:23
text: For they said to me, "Make us gods, which shall go before us; for as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we don"t know what has become of him."

name: Exodus 32:24
text: I said to them, "Whoever has any gold, let them take it off:" so they gave it to me; and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf."

name: Exodus 32:25
text: When Moses saw that the people had broken loose, (for Aaron had let them loose for a derision among their enemies),

name: Exodus 32:26
text: then Moses stood in the gate of the camp, and said, "Whoever is on Yahweh"s side, come to me!" All the sons of Levi gathered themselves together to him.

name: Exodus 32:27
text: He said to them, "Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel, "Every man put his sword on his thigh, and go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and every man kill his brother, and every man his companion, and every man his neighbor.""

name: Exodus 32:28
text: The sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.

name: Exodus 32:29
text: Moses said, "Consecrate yourselves today to Yahweh, yes, every man against his son, and against his brother; that he may bestow on you a blessing this day."

name: Exodus 32:30
text: It happened on the next day, that Moses said to the people, "You have sinned a great sin. Now I will go up to Yahweh. Perhaps I shall make atonement for your sin."

name: Exodus 32:31
text: Moses returned to Yahweh, and said, "Oh, this people have sinned a great sin, and have made themselves gods of gold.

name: Exodus 32:32
text: Yet now, if you will, forgive their sin"and if not, please blot me out of your book which you have written."

name: Exodus 32:33
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Whoever has sinned against me, him will I blot out of my book.

name: Exodus 32:34
text: Now go, lead the people to the place of which I have spoken to you. Behold, my angel shall go before you. Nevertheless in the day when I punish, I will punish them for their sin."

name: Exodus 32:35
text: Yahweh struck the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.

name: Exodus 33:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, "Depart, go up from here, you and the people that you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, "I will give it to your seed."

name: Exodus 33:2
text: I will send an angel before you; and I will drive out the Canaanite, the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite:

name: Exodus 33:3
text: to a land flowing with milk and honey: for I will not go up in the midst of you, for you are a stiff-necked people, lest I consume you in the way."

name: Exodus 33:4
text: When the people heard this evil news, they mourned: and no one put on his jewelry.

name: Exodus 33:5
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Tell the children of Israel, "You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go up into your midst for one moment, I would consume you. Therefore now take off your jewelry from you, that I may know what to do to you.""

name: Exodus 33:6
text: The children of Israel stripped themselves of their jewelry from Mount Horeb onward.

name: Exodus 33:7
text: Now Moses used to take the tent and to pitch it outside the camp, far away from the camp, and he called it "The Tent of Meeting." It happened that everyone who sought Yahweh went out to the Tent of Meeting, which was outside the camp.

name: Exodus 33:8
text: It happened that when Moses went out to the Tent, that all the people rose up, and stood, everyone at their tent door, and watched Moses, until he had gone into the Tent.

name: Exodus 33:9
text: It happened, when Moses entered into the Tent, that the pillar of cloud descended, stood at the door of the Tent, and spoke with Moses.

name: Exodus 33:10
text: All the people saw the pillar of cloud stand at the door of the Tent, and all the people rose up and worshiped, everyone at their tent door.

name: Exodus 33:11
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. He turned again into the camp, but his servant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, didn"t depart out of the Tent.

name: Exodus 33:12
text: Moses said to Yahweh, "Behold, you tell me, "Bring up this people:" and you haven"t let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, "I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my sight."

name: Exodus 33:13
text: Now therefore, if I have found favor in your sight, please show me now your ways, that I may know you, so that I may find favor in your sight: and consider that this nation is your people."

name: Exodus 33:14
text: He said, "My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest."

name: Exodus 33:15
text: He said to him, "If your presence doesn"t go with me, don"t carry us up from here.

name: Exodus 33:16
text: For how would people know that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people? Isn"t it in that you go with us, so that we are separated, I and your people, from all the people who are on the surface of the earth?"

name: Exodus 33:17
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "I will do this thing also that you have spoken; for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name."

name: Exodus 33:18
text: He said, "Please show me your glory."

name: Exodus 33:19
text: He said, "I will make all my goodness pass before you, and will proclaim the name of Yahweh before you. I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious, and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy."

name: Exodus 33:20
text: He said, "You cannot see my face, for man may not see me and live."

name: Exodus 33:21
text: Yahweh also said, "Behold, there is a place by me, and you shall stand on the rock.

name: Exodus 33:22
text: It will happen, while my glory passes by, that I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and will cover you with my hand until I have passed by;

name: Exodus 33:23
text: then I will take away my hand, and you will see my back; but my face shall not be seen."

name: Exodus 34:1
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Chisel two stone tablets like the first: and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.

name: Exodus 34:2
text: Be ready by the morning, and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai, and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain.

name: Exodus 34:3
text: No one shall come up with you; neither let anyone be seen throughout all the mountain; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mountain."

name: Exodus 34:4
text: He chiseled two tablets of stone like the first; and Moses rose up early in the morning, and went up to Mount Sinai, as Yahweh had commanded him, and took in his hand two stone tablets.

name: Exodus 34:5
text: Yahweh descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of Yahweh.

name: Exodus 34:6
text: Yahweh passed by before him, and proclaimed, "Yahweh! Yahweh, a merciful and gracious God, slow to anger, and abundant in loving kindness and truth,

name: Exodus 34:7
text: keeping loving kindness for thousands, forgiving iniquity and disobedience and sin; and that will by no means clear the guilty, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on the children, and on the children"s children, on the third and on the fourth generation."

name: Exodus 34:8
text: Moses hurried and bowed his head toward the earth, and worshiped.

name: Exodus 34:9
text: He said, "If now I have found favor in your sight, Lord, please let the Lord go in the midst of us; although this is a stiff-necked people; pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance."

name: Exodus 34:10
text: He said, "Behold, I make a covenant: before all your people I will do marvels, such as have not been worked in all the earth, nor in any nation; and all the people among which you are shall see the work of Yahweh; for it is an awesome thing that I do with you.

name: Exodus 34:11
text: Observe that which I command you this day. Behold, I drive out before you the Amorite, the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite.

name: Exodus 34:12
text: Be careful, lest you make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land where you are going, lest it be for a snare in the midst of you:

name: Exodus 34:13
text: but you shall break down their altars, and dash in pieces their pillars, and you shall cut down their Asherim;

name: Exodus 34:14
