text: for you shall worship no other god: for Yahweh, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.

name: Exodus 34:15
text: "Don"t make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, lest they play the prostitute after their gods, and sacrifice to their gods, and one call you and you eat of his sacrifice;

name: Exodus 34:16
text: and you take of their daughters to your sons, and their daughters play the prostitute after their gods, and make your sons play the prostitute after their gods.

name: Exodus 34:17
text: "You shall make no cast idols for yourselves.

name: Exodus 34:18
text: "You shall keep the feast of unleavened bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month Abib; for in the month Abib you came out from Egypt.

name: Exodus 34:19
text: "All that opens the womb is mine; and all your livestock that is male, the firstborn of cow and sheep.

name: Exodus 34:20
text: The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb: and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem. No one shall appear before me empty.

name: Exodus 34:21
text: "Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest: in plowing time and in harvest you shall rest.

name: Exodus 34:22
text: "You shall observe the feast of weeks with the first fruits of wheat harvest, and the feast of harvest at the year"s end.

name: Exodus 34:23
text: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord Yahweh, the God of Israel.

name: Exodus 34:24
text: For I will drive out nations before you and enlarge your borders; neither shall any man desire your land when you go up to appear before Yahweh, your God, three times in the year.

name: Exodus 34:25
text: "You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leavened bread; neither shall the sacrifice of the feast of the Passover be left to the morning.

name: Exodus 34:26
text: "You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. "You shall not boil a young goat in its mother"s milk."

name: Exodus 34:27
text: Yahweh said to Moses, "Write you these words: for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel."

name: Exodus 34:28
text: He was there with Yahweh forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread, nor drank water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.

name: Exodus 34:29
text: It happened, when Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the testimony in Moses" hand, when he came down from the mountain, that Moses didn"t know that the skin of his face shone by reason of his speaking with him.

name: Exodus 34:30
text: When Aaron and all the children of Israel saw Moses, behold, the skin of his face shone; and they were afraid to come near him.

name: Exodus 34:31
text: Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the rulers of the congregation returned to him; and Moses spoke to them.

name: Exodus 34:32
text: Afterward all the children of Israel came near, and he gave them all of the commandments that Yahweh had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.

name: Exodus 34:33
text: When Moses was done speaking with them, he put a veil on his face.

name: Exodus 34:34
text: But when Moses went in before Yahweh to speak with him, he took the veil off, until he came out; and he came out, and spoke to the children of Israel that which he was commanded.

name: Exodus 34:35
text: The children of Israel saw Moses" face, that the skin of Moses" face shone: and Moses put the veil on his face again, until he went in to speak with him.

name: Exodus 35:1
text: Moses assembled all the congregation of the children of Israel, and said to them, "These are the words which Yahweh has commanded, that you should do them.

name: Exodus 35:2
text: "Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy day for you, a Sabbath of solemn rest to Yahweh: whoever does any work in it shall be put to death.

name: Exodus 35:3
text: You shall kindle no fire throughout your habitations on the Sabbath day.""

name: Exodus 35:4
text: Moses spoke to all the congregation of the children of Israel, saying, "This is the thing which Yahweh commanded, saying,

name: Exodus 35:5
text: "Take from among you an offering to Yahweh. Whoever is of a willing heart, let him bring it, Yahweh"s offering: gold, silver, brass,

name: Exodus 35:6
text: blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats" hair,

name: Exodus 35:7
text: rams" skins dyed red, sea cow hides, acacia wood,

name: Exodus 35:8
text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,

name: Exodus 35:9
text: onyx stones, and stones to be set for the ephod and for the breastplate.

name: Exodus 35:10
text: ""Let every wise-hearted man among you come, and make all that Yahweh has commanded:

name: Exodus 35:11
text: the tabernacle, its outer covering, its roof, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, and its sockets;

name: Exodus 35:12
text: the ark, and its poles, the mercy seat, the veil of the screen;

name: Exodus 35:13
text: the table with its poles and all its vessels, and the show bread;

name: Exodus 35:14
text: the lampstand also for the light, with its vessels, its lamps, and the oil for the light;

name: Exodus 35:15
text: and the altar of incense with its poles, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door, at the door of the tabernacle;

name: Exodus 35:16
text: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base;

name: Exodus 35:17
text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, their sockets, and the screen for the gate of the court;

name: Exodus 35:18
text: the pins of the tabernacle, the pins of the court, and their cords;

name: Exodus 35:19
text: the finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest"s office.""

name: Exodus 35:20
text: All the congregation of the children of Israel departed from the presence of Moses.

name: Exodus 35:21
text: They came, everyone whose heart stirred him up, and everyone whom his spirit made willing, and brought Yahweh"s offering, for the work of the Tent of Meeting, and for all of its service, and for the holy garments.

name: Exodus 35:22
text: They came, both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, and brought brooches, earrings, signet rings, and armlets, all jewels of gold; even every man who offered an offering of gold to Yahweh.

name: Exodus 35:23
text: Everyone, with whom was found blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats" hair, rams" skins dyed red, and sea cow hides, brought them.

name: Exodus 35:24
text: Everyone who offered an offering of silver and brass brought Yahweh"s offering; and everyone, with whom was found acacia wood for any work of the service, brought it.

name: Exodus 35:25
text: All the women who were wise-hearted spun with their hands, and brought that which they had spun, the blue, the purple, the scarlet, and the fine linen.

name: Exodus 35:26
text: All the women whose heart stirred them up in wisdom spun the goats" hair.

name: Exodus 35:27
text: The rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastplate;

name: Exodus 35:28
text: and the spice, and the oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the sweet incense.

name: Exodus 35:29
text: The children of Israel brought a freewill offering to Yahweh; every man and woman, whose heart made them willing to bring for all the work, which Yahweh had commanded to be made by Moses.

name: Exodus 35:30
text: Moses said to the children of Israel, "Behold, Yahweh has called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.

name: Exodus 35:31
text: He has filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, in understanding, in knowledge, and in all kinds of workmanship;

name: Exodus 35:32
text: and to make skillful works, to work in gold, in silver, in brass,

name: Exodus 35:33
text: in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of skillful workmanship.

name: Exodus 35:34
text: He has put in his heart that he may teach, both he, and Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.

name: Exodus 35:35
text: He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all kinds of workmanship, of the engraver, of the skillful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship, and of those who make skillful works.

name: Exodus 36:1
text: "Bezalel and Oholiab shall work with every wise-hearted man, in whom Yahweh has put wisdom and understanding to know how to work all the work for the service of the sanctuary, according to all that Yahweh has commanded."

name: Exodus 36:2
text: Moses called Bezalel and Oholiab, and every wise-hearted man, in whose heart Yahweh had put wisdom, even everyone whose heart stirred him up to come to the work to do it:

name: Exodus 36:3
text: and they received from Moses all the offering which the children of Israel had brought for the work of the service of the sanctuary, with which to make it. They brought yet to him freewill offerings every morning.

name: Exodus 36:4
text: All the wise men, who performed all the work of the sanctuary, each came from his work which they did.

name: Exodus 36:5
text: They spoke to Moses, saying, "The people bring much more than enough for the service of the work which Yahweh commanded to make."

name: Exodus 36:6
text: Moses gave commandment, and they caused it to be proclaimed throughout the camp, saying, "Let neither man nor woman make anything else for the offering for the sanctuary." So the people were restrained from bringing.

name: Exodus 36:7
text: For the stuff they had was sufficient for all the work to make it, and too much.

name: Exodus 36:8
text: All the wise-hearted men among those who did the work made the tabernacle with ten curtains; of fine twined linen, blue, purple, and scarlet, with cherubim, the work of the skillful workman, they made them.

name: Exodus 36:9
text: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure.

name: Exodus 36:10
text: He coupled five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he coupled one to another.

name: Exodus 36:11
text: He made loops of blue on the edge of the one curtain from the edge in the coupling. Likewise he made in the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the second coupling.

name: Exodus 36:12
text: He made fifty loops in the one curtain, and he made fifty loops in the edge of the curtain that was in the second coupling. The loops were opposite one to another.

name: Exodus 36:13
text: He made fifty clasps of gold, and coupled the curtains one to another with the clasps: so the tabernacle was a unit.

name: Exodus 36:14
text: He made curtains of goats" hair for a covering over the tabernacle. He made them eleven curtains.

name: Exodus 36:15
text: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure.

name: Exodus 36:16
text: He coupled five curtains by themselves, and six curtains by themselves.

name: Exodus 36:17
text: He made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was outmost in the coupling, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain which was outmost in the second coupling.

name: Exodus 36:18
text: He made fifty clasps of brass to couple the tent together, that it might be a unit.

name: Exodus 36:19
text: He made a covering for the tent of rams" skins dyed red, and a covering of sea cow hides above.

name: Exodus 36:20
text: He made the boards for the tabernacle of acacia wood, standing up.

name: Exodus 36:21
text: Ten cubits was the length of a board, and a cubit and a half the breadth of each board.

name: Exodus 36:22
text: Each board had two tenons, joined one to another. He made all the boards of the tabernacle this way.

name: Exodus 36:23
text: He made the boards for the tabernacle: twenty boards for the south side southward.

name: Exodus 36:24
text: He made forty sockets of silver under the twenty boards; two sockets under one board for its two tenons, and two sockets under another board for its two tenons.

name: Exodus 36:25
text: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty boards,

name: Exodus 36:26
text: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

name: Exodus 36:27
text: For the far part of the tabernacle westward he made six boards.

name: Exodus 36:28
text: He made two boards for the corners of the tabernacle in the far part.

name: Exodus 36:29
text: They were double beneath, and in the same way they were all the way to its top to one ring. He did this to both of them in the two corners.

name: Exodus 36:30
text: There were eight boards, and their sockets of silver, sixteen sockets; under every board two sockets.

name: Exodus 36:31
text: He made bars of acacia wood; five for the boards of the one side of the tabernacle,

name: Exodus 36:32
text: and five bars for the boards of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the boards of the tabernacle for the hinder part westward.

name: Exodus 36:33
text: He made the middle bar to pass through in the midst of the boards from the one end to the other.

name: Exodus 36:34
text: He overlaid the boards with gold, and made their rings of gold for places for the bars, and overlaid the bars with gold.

name: Exodus 36:35
text: He made the veil of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen: with cherubim. He made it the work of a skillful workman.

name: Exodus 36:36
text: He made four pillars of acacia for it, and overlaid them with gold. Their hooks were of gold. He cast four sockets of silver for them.

name: Exodus 36:37
text: He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer;

name: Exodus 36:38
text: and the five pillars of it with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their fillets with gold, and their five sockets were of brass.

name: Exodus 37:1
text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, and its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.

name: Exodus 37:2
text: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold for it around it.

name: Exodus 37:3
text: He cast four rings of gold for it, in its four feet; even two rings on its one side, and two rings on its other side.

name: Exodus 37:4
text: He made poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

name: Exodus 37:5
text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to bear the ark.

name: Exodus 37:6
text: He made a mercy seat of pure gold. Its length was two and a half cubits, and a cubit and a half its breadth.

name: Exodus 37:7
text: He made two cherubim of gold. He made them of beaten work, at the two ends of the mercy seat;

name: Exodus 37:8
text: one cherub at the one end, and one cherub at the other end. He made the cherubim of one piece with the mercy seat at its two ends.

name: Exodus 37:9
text: The cherubim spread out their wings on high, covering the mercy seat with their wings, with their faces toward one another. The faces of the cherubim were toward the mercy seat.

name: Exodus 37:10
text: He made the table of acacia wood. Its length was two cubits, and its breadth was a cubit, and its height was a cubit and a half.

name: Exodus 37:11
text: He overlaid it with pure gold, and made a gold molding around it.

name: Exodus 37:12
text: He made a border of a handbreadth around it, and made a golden molding on its border around it.

name: Exodus 37:13
text: He cast four rings of gold for it, and put the rings in the four corners that were on its four feet.

name: Exodus 37:14
text: The rings were close by the border, the places for the poles to carry the table.

name: Exodus 37:15
text: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold, to carry the table.

name: Exodus 37:16
text: He made the vessels which were on the table, its dishes, its spoons, its bowls, and its pitchers with which to pour out, of pure gold.

name: Exodus 37:17
text: He made the lampstand of pure gold. He made the lampstand of beaten work. Its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers were of one piece with it.

name: Exodus 37:18
text: There were six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of its one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of its other side:

name: Exodus 37:19
text: three cups made like almond blossoms in one branch, a bud and a flower, and three cups made like almond blossoms in the other branch, a bud and a flower: so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.

name: Exodus 37:20
text: In the lampstand were four cups made like almond blossoms, its buds and its flowers;

name: Exodus 37:21
text: and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, and a bud under two branches of one piece with it, for the six branches going out of it.

name: Exodus 37:22
text: Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold.

name: Exodus 37:23
text: He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold.

name: Exodus 37:24
text: He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.

name: Exodus 37:25
text: He made the altar of incense of acacia wood. It was square: its length was a cubit, and its breadth a cubit. Its height was two cubits. Its horns were of one piece with it.

name: Exodus 37:26
text: He overlaid it with pure gold, its top, its sides around it, and its horns. He made a gold molding around it.

name: Exodus 37:27
text: He made two golden rings for it under its molding crown, on its two ribs, on its two sides, for places for poles with which to carry it.

name: Exodus 37:28
text: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

name: Exodus 37:29
text: He made the holy anointing oil and the pure incense of sweet spices, after the art of the perfumer.

name: Exodus 38:1
text: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. It was square. Its length was five cubits, its breadth was five cubits, and its height was three cubits.

name: Exodus 38:2
text: He made its horns on its four corners. Its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with brass.

name: Exodus 38:3
text: He made all the vessels of the altar, the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the fire pans. He made all its vessels of brass.

name: Exodus 38:4
text: He made for the altar a grating of a network of brass, under the ledge around it beneath, reaching halfway up.

name: Exodus 38:5
text: He cast four rings for the four ends of brass grating, to be places for the poles.

name: Exodus 38:6
text: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with brass.

name: Exodus 38:7
text: He put the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar, with which to carry it. He made it hollow with planks.

name: Exodus 38:8
text: He made the basin of brass, and its base of brass, out of the mirrors of the ministering women who ministered at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Exodus 38:9
text: He made the court: for the south side southward the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen, one hundred cubits;

name: Exodus 38:10
text: their pillars were twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver.

name: Exodus 38:11
text: For the north side one hundred cubits, their pillars twenty, and their sockets twenty, of brass; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

name: Exodus 38:12
text: For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

name: Exodus 38:13
text: For the east side eastward fifty cubits.

name: Exodus 38:14
text: The hangings for the one side were fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three;

name: Exodus 38:15
text: and so for the other side: on this hand and that hand by the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits; their pillars three, and their sockets three.

name: Exodus 38:16
text: All the hangings around the court were of fine twined linen.

name: Exodus 38:17
text: The sockets for the pillars were of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their fillets were of silver; and the overlaying of their capitals, of silver; and all the pillars of the court were filleted with silver.

name: Exodus 38:18
text: The screen for the gate of the court was the work of the embroiderer, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen. Twenty cubits was the length, and the height in the breadth was five cubits, like to the hangings of the court.

name: Exodus 38:19
text: Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.

name: Exodus 38:20
text: All the pins of the tabernacle, and around the court, were of brass.

name: Exodus 38:21
text: This is the amount of material used for the tabernacle, even the Tabernacle of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

name: Exodus 38:22
text: Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 38:23
text: With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.

name: Exodus 38:24
text: All the gold that was used for the work in all the work of the sanctuary, even the gold of the offering, was twenty-nine talents, and seven hundred thirty shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary.

name: Exodus 38:25
text: The silver of those who were numbered of the congregation was one hundred talents, and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary:

name: Exodus 38:26
text: a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men.

name: Exodus 38:27
text: The one hundred talents of silver were for casting the sockets of the sanctuary, and the sockets of the veil; one hundred sockets for the one hundred talents, a talent for a socket.

name: Exodus 38:28
text: Of the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars, overlaid their capitals, and made fillets for them.

name: Exodus 38:29
text: The brass of the offering was seventy talents, and two thousand four hundred shekels.

name: Exodus 38:30
text: With this he made the sockets to the door of the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar, the bronze grating for it, all the vessels of the altar,

name: Exodus 38:31
text: the sockets around the court, the sockets of the gate of the court, all the pins of the tabernacle, and all the pins around the court.

name: Exodus 39:1
text: Of the blue, purple, and scarlet, they made finely worked garments, for ministering in the holy place, and made the holy garments for Aaron; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:2
text: He made the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.

name: Exodus 39:3
text: They beat the gold into thin plates, and cut it into wires, to work it in the blue, in the purple, in the scarlet, and in the fine linen, the work of the skillful workman.

name: Exodus 39:4
text: They made shoulder straps for it, joined together. At the two ends it was joined together.

name: Exodus 39:5
text: The skillfully woven band that was on it, with which to fasten it on, was of the same piece, like its work; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:6
text: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.

name: Exodus 39:7
text: He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:8
text: He made the breastplate, the work of a skillful workman, like the work of the ephod; of gold, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.

name: Exodus 39:9
text: It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its breadth a span, being double.

name: Exodus 39:10
text: They set in it four rows of stones. A row of ruby, topaz, and beryl was the first row;

name: Exodus 39:11
text: and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;

name: Exodus 39:12
text: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;

name: Exodus 39:13
text: and the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They were enclosed in gold settings.

name: Exodus 39:14
text: The stones were according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, for the twelve tribes.

name: Exodus 39:15
text: They made on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold.

name: Exodus 39:16
text: They made two settings of gold, and two gold rings, and put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.

name: Exodus 39:17
text: They put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.

name: Exodus 39:18
text: The other two ends of the two braided chains they put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, in its front.

name: Exodus 39:19
text: They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which was toward the side of the ephod inward.

name: Exodus 39:20
text: They made two rings of gold, and put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its front, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.

name: Exodus 39:21
text: They bound the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it might be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate might not come loose from the ephod, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:22
text: He made the robe of the ephod of woven work, all of blue.

name: Exodus 39:23
text: The opening of the robe in its midst was like the opening of a coat of mail, with a binding around its opening, that it should not be torn.

name: Exodus 39:24
text: They made on the skirts of the robe pomegranates of blue, purple, scarlet, and twined linen.

name: Exodus 39:25
text: They made bells of pure gold, and put the bells between the pomegranates around the skirts of the robe, between the pomegranates;

name: Exodus 39:26
text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:27
text: They made the coats of fine linen of woven work for Aaron, and for his sons,

name: Exodus 39:28
text: and the turban of fine linen, and the linen headbands of fine linen, and the linen breeches of fine twined linen,

name: Exodus 39:29
text: and the sash of fine twined linen, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, the work of the embroiderer, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:30
text: They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and wrote on it a writing, like the engravings of a signet: "HOLY TO YAHWEH."

name: Exodus 39:31
text: They tied to it a lace of blue, to fasten it on the turban above, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 39:32
text: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses; so they did.

name: Exodus 39:33
text: They brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent, with all its furniture, its clasps, its boards, its bars, its pillars, its sockets,

name: Exodus 39:34
text: the covering of rams" skins dyed red, the covering of sea cow hides, the veil of the screen,

name: Exodus 39:35
text: the ark of the testimony with its poles, the mercy seat,

name: Exodus 39:36
text: the table, all its vessels, the show bread,

name: Exodus 39:37
text: the pure lampstand, its lamps, even the lamps to be set in order, all its vessels, the oil for the light,

name: Exodus 39:38
text: the golden altar, the anointing oil, the sweet incense, the screen for the door of the Tent,

name: Exodus 39:39
text: the bronze altar, its grating of brass, its poles, all of its vessels, the basin and its base,

name: Exodus 39:40
text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, its sockets, the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, its pins, all the instruments of the service of the tabernacle, for the Tent of Meeting,

name: Exodus 39:41
text: the finely worked garments for ministering in the holy place, the holy garments for Aaron the priest, and the garments of his sons, to minister in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 39:42
text: According to all that Yahweh commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did all the work.

name: Exodus 39:43
text: Moses saw all the work, and behold, they had done it as Yahweh had commanded, even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.

name: Exodus 40:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Exodus 40:2
text: "On the first day of the first month you shall raise up the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Exodus 40:3
text: You shall put the ark of the testimony in it, and you shall screen the ark with the veil.

name: Exodus 40:4
text: You shall bring in the table, and set in order the things that are on it. You shall bring in the lampstand, and light its lamps.

name: Exodus 40:5
text: You shall set the golden altar for incense before the ark of the testimony, and put the screen of the door to the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 40:6
text: "You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Exodus 40:7
text: You shall set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and shall put water therein.

name: Exodus 40:8
text: You shall set up the court around it, and hang up the screen of the gate of the court.

name: Exodus 40:9
text: "You shall take the anointing oil, and anoint the tabernacle, and all that is in it, and shall make it holy, and all its furniture: and it will be holy.

name: Exodus 40:10
text: You shall anoint the altar of burnt offering, with all its vessels, and sanctify the altar: and the altar will be most holy.

name: Exodus 40:11
text: You shall anoint the basin and its base, and sanctify it.

name: Exodus 40:12
text: "You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the Tent of Meeting, and shall wash them with water.

name: Exodus 40:13
text: You shall put on Aaron the holy garments; and you shall anoint him, and sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest"s office.

name: Exodus 40:14
text: You shall bring his sons, and put coats on them.

name: Exodus 40:15
text: You shall anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may minister to me in the priest"s office. Their anointing shall be to them for an everlasting priesthood throughout their generations."

name: Exodus 40:16
text: Moses did so. According to all that Yahweh commanded him, so he did.

name: Exodus 40:17
text: It happened in the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, that the tabernacle was raised up.

name: Exodus 40:18
text: Moses raised up the tabernacle, and laid its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and raised up its pillars.

name: Exodus 40:19
text: He spread the covering over the tent, and put the roof of the tabernacle above on it, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:20
text: He took and put the testimony into the ark, and set the poles on the ark, and put the mercy seat above on the ark.

name: Exodus 40:21
text: He brought the ark into the tabernacle, and set up the veil of the screen, and screened the ark of the testimony, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:22
text: He put the table in the Tent of Meeting, on the side of the tabernacle northward, outside of the veil.

name: Exodus 40:23
text: He set the bread in order on it before Yahweh, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:24
text: He put the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting, opposite the table, on the side of the tabernacle southward.

name: Exodus 40:25
text: He lit the lamps before Yahweh, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:26
text: He put the golden altar in the Tent of Meeting before the veil;

name: Exodus 40:27
text: and he burnt incense of sweet spices on it, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:28
text: He put up the screen of the door to the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 40:29
text: He set the altar of burnt offering at the door of the tabernacle of the Tent of Meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the meal offering, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:30
text: He set the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water therein, with which to wash.

name: Exodus 40:31
text: Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and their feet there.

name: Exodus 40:32
text: When they went into the Tent of Meeting, and when they came near to the altar, they washed, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Exodus 40:33
text: He raised up the court around the tabernacle and the altar, and set up the screen of the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.

name: Exodus 40:34
text: Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of Yahweh filled the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 40:35
text: Moses wasn"t able to enter into the Tent of Meeting, because the cloud stayed on it, and Yahweh"s glory filled the tabernacle.

name: Exodus 40:36
text: When the cloud was taken up from over the tabernacle, the children of Israel went onward, throughout all their journeys;

name: Exodus 40:37
text: but if the cloud wasn"t taken up, then they didn"t travel until the day that it was taken up.

name: Exodus 40:38
text: For the cloud of Yahweh was on the tabernacle by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.

name: Leviticus 1:1
text: Yahweh called to Moses, and spoke to him out of the Tent of Meeting, saying,

name: Leviticus 1:2
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them, "When anyone of you offers an offering to Yahweh, you shall offer your offering of the livestock, from the herd and from the flock.

name: Leviticus 1:3
text: ""If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without blemish. He shall offer it at the door of the Tent of Meeting, that he may be accepted before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 1:4
text: He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

name: Leviticus 1:5
text: He shall kill the bull before Yahweh. Aaron"s sons, the priests, shall present the blood and sprinkle the blood around on the altar that is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 1:6
text: He shall flay the burnt offering, and cut it into pieces.

name: Leviticus 1:7
text: The sons of Aaron the priest shall put fire on the altar, and lay wood in order on the fire;

name: Leviticus 1:8
text: and Aaron"s sons, the priests, shall lay the pieces, the head, and the fat in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar;

name: Leviticus 1:9
text: but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 1:10
text: ""If his offering is from the flock, from the sheep, or from the goats, for a burnt offering, he shall offer a male without blemish.

name: Leviticus 1:11
text: He shall kill it on the north side of the altar before Yahweh. Aaron"s sons, the priests, shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 1:12
text: He shall cut it into its pieces, with its head and its fat. The priest shall lay them in order on the wood that is on the fire which is on the altar,

name: Leviticus 1:13
text: but the innards and the legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall offer the whole, and burn it on the altar. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 1:14
text: ""If his offering to Yahweh is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall offer his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.

name: Leviticus 1:15
text: The priest shall bring it to the altar, and wring off its head, and burn it on the altar; and its blood shall be drained out on the side of the altar;

name: Leviticus 1:16
text: and he shall take away its crop with its filth, and cast it beside the altar on the east part, in the place of the ashes.

name: Leviticus 1:17
text: He shall tear it by its wings, but shall not divide it apart. The priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 2:1
text: ""When anyone offers an offering of a meal offering to Yahweh, his offering shall be of fine flour; and he shall pour oil on it, and put frankincense on it.

name: Leviticus 2:2
text: He shall bring it to Aaron"s sons, the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn its memorial on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 2:3
text: That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron"s and his sons". It is a most holy thing of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire.

name: Leviticus 2:4
text: ""When you offer an offering of a meal offering baked in the oven, it shall be unleavened cakes of fine flour mixed with oil, or unleavened wafers anointed with oil.

name: Leviticus 2:5
text: If your offering is a meal offering of the griddle, it shall be of unleavened fine flour, mixed with oil.

name: Leviticus 2:6
text: You shall cut it in pieces, and pour oil on it. It is a meal offering.

name: Leviticus 2:7
text: If your offering is a meal offering of the pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil.

name: Leviticus 2:8
text: You shall bring the meal offering that is made of these things to Yahweh: and it shall be presented to the priest, and he shall bring it to the altar.

name: Leviticus 2:9
text: The priest shall take from the meal offering its memorial, and shall burn it on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 2:10
text: That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron"s and his sons". It is a thing most holy of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire.

name: Leviticus 2:11
text: ""No meal offering, which you shall offer to Yahweh, shall be made with yeast; for you shall burn no yeast, nor any honey, as an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 2:12
text: As an offering of firstfruits you shall offer them to Yahweh: but they shall not ascend for a pleasant aroma on the altar.

name: Leviticus 2:13
text: Every offering of your meal offering you shall season with salt; neither shall you allow the salt of the covenant of your God to be lacking from your meal offering. With all your offerings you shall offer salt.

name: Leviticus 2:14
text: ""If you offer a meal offering of first fruits to Yahweh, you shall offer for the meal offering of your first fruits grain in the ear parched with fire, bruised grain of the fresh ear.

name: Leviticus 2:15
text: You shall put oil on it, and lay frankincense on it: it is a meal offering.

name: Leviticus 2:16
text: The priest shall burn as its memorial, part of its bruised grain, and part of its oil, along with all its frankincense: it is an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 3:1
text: ""If his offering is a sacrifice of peace offerings; if he offers it from the herd, whether male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 3:2
text: He shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it at the door of the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron"s sons, the priests shall sprinkle the blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 3:3
text: He shall offer of the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to Yahweh; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

name: Leviticus 3:4
text: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away.

name: Leviticus 3:5
text: Aaron"s sons shall burn it on the altar on the burnt offering, which is on the wood that is on the fire: it is an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 3:6
text: ""If his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings to Yahweh is from the flock; male or female, he shall offer it without blemish.

name: Leviticus 3:7
text: If he offers a lamb for his offering, then he shall offer it before Yahweh;

name: Leviticus 3:8
text: and he shall lay his hand on the head of his offering, and kill it before the Tent of Meeting: and Aaron"s sons shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 3:9
text: He shall offer from the sacrifice of peace offerings an offering made by fire to Yahweh; its fat, the entire tail fat, he shall take away close to the backbone; and the fat that covers the inwards, and all the fat that is on the inwards,

name: Leviticus 3:10
text: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away.

name: Leviticus 3:11
text: The priest shall burn it on the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 3:12
text: ""If his offering is a goat, then he shall offer it before Yahweh:

name: Leviticus 3:13
text: and he shall lay his hand on its head, and kill it before the Tent of Meeting; and the sons of Aaron shall sprinkle its blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 3:14
text: He shall offer from it as his offering, an offering made by fire to Yahweh; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

name: Leviticus 3:15
text: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away.

name: Leviticus 3:16
text: The priest shall burn them on the altar: it is the food of the offering made by fire, for a pleasant aroma; all the fat is Yahweh"s.

name: Leviticus 3:17
text: ""It shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations in all your dwellings, that you shall eat neither fat nor blood.""

name: Leviticus 4:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 4:2
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, "If anyone sins unintentionally, in any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and does any one of them:

name: Leviticus 4:3
text: if the anointed priest sins so as to bring guilt on the people, then let him offer for his sin, which he has sinned, a young bull without blemish to Yahweh for a sin offering.

name: Leviticus 4:4
text: He shall bring the bull to the door of the Tent of Meeting before Yahweh; and he shall lay his hand on the head of the bull, and kill the bull before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 4:5
text: The anointed priest shall take some of the blood of the bull, and bring it to the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 4:6
text: The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before Yahweh, before the veil of the sanctuary.

name: Leviticus 4:7
text: The priest shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of sweet incense before Yahweh, which is in the Tent of Meeting; and he shall pour out all of rest of the blood of the bull at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 4:8
text: He shall take all the fat of the bull of the sin offering off of it; the fat that covers the innards, and all the fat that is on the innards,

name: Leviticus 4:9
text: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, he shall take away,

name: Leviticus 4:10
text: as it is taken off of the bull of the sacrifice of peace offerings. The priest shall burn them on the altar of burnt offering.

name: Leviticus 4:11
text: The bull"s skin, all its flesh, with its head, and with its legs, its innards, and its dung,

name: Leviticus 4:12
text: even the whole bull shall he carry forth outside the camp to a clean place, where the ashes are poured out, and burn it on wood with fire. Where the ashes are poured out it shall be burned.

name: Leviticus 4:13
text: ""If the whole congregation of Israel sins, and the thing is hidden from the eyes of the assembly, and they have done any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and are guilty;

name: Leviticus 4:14
text: when the sin in which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 4:15
text: The elders of the congregation shall lay their hands on the head of the bull before Yahweh; and the bull shall be killed before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 4:16
text: The anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bull to the Tent of Meeting:

name: Leviticus 4:17
text: and the priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle it seven times before Yahweh, before the veil.

name: Leviticus 4:18
text: He shall put some of the blood on the horns of the altar which is before Yahweh, that is in the Tent of Meeting; and the rest of the blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar of burnt offering, which is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 4:19
text: All its fat he shall take from it, and burn it on the altar.

name: Leviticus 4:20
text: Thus shall he do with the bull; as he did with the bull of the sin offering, so shall he do with this; and the priest shall make atonement for them, and they shall be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 4:21
text: He shall carry forth the bull outside the camp, and burn it as he burned the first bull. It is the sin offering for the assembly.

name: Leviticus 4:22
text: ""When a ruler sins, and unwittingly does any one of all the things which Yahweh his God has commanded not to be done, and is guilty;

name: Leviticus 4:23
text: if his sin, in which he has sinned, is made known to him, he shall bring as his offering a goat, a male without blemish.

name: Leviticus 4:24
text: He shall lay his hand on the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before Yahweh. It is a sin offering.

name: Leviticus 4:25
text: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering. He shall pour out the rest of its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering.

name: Leviticus 4:26
text: All its fat he shall burn on the altar, like the fat of the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin, and he will be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 4:27
text: ""If anyone of the common people sins unwittingly, in doing any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done, and is guilty;

name: Leviticus 4:28
text: if his sin, which he has sinned, is made known to him, then he shall bring for his offering a goat, a female without blemish, for his sin which he has sinned.

name: Leviticus 4:29
text: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill the sin offering in the place of burnt offering.

name: Leviticus 4:30
text: The priest shall take some of its blood with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

name: Leviticus 4:31
text: All its fat he shall take away, like the fat is taken away from off of the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn it on the altar for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh; and the priest shall make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 4:32
text: ""If he brings a lamb as his offering for a sin offering, he shall bring a female without blemish.

name: Leviticus 4:33
text: He shall lay his hand on the head of the sin offering, and kill it for a sin offering in the place where they kill the burnt offering.

name: Leviticus 4:34
text: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering; and all the rest of its blood he shall pour out at the base of the altar.

name: Leviticus 4:35
text: All its fat he shall take away, like the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn them on the altar, on the offerings of Yahweh made by fire; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned, and he will be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 5:1
text: ""If anyone sins, in that he hears the voice of adjuration, he being a witness, whether he has seen or known, if he doesn"t report it, then he shall bear his iniquity.

name: Leviticus 5:2
text: ""Or if anyone touches any unclean thing, whether it is the carcass of an unclean animal, or the carcass of unclean livestock, or the carcass of unclean creeping things, and it is hidden from him, and he is unclean, then he shall be guilty.

name: Leviticus 5:3
text: ""Or if he touches the uncleanness of man, whatever his uncleanness is with which he is unclean, and it is hidden from him; when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty.

name: Leviticus 5:4
text: ""Or if anyone swears rashly with his lips to do evil, or to do good, whatever it is that a man might utter rashly with an oath, and it is hidden from him; when he knows of it, then he shall be guilty of one of these.

name: Leviticus 5:5
text: It shall be, when he is guilty of one of these, he shall confess that in which he has sinned:

name: Leviticus 5:6
text: and he shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh for his sin which he has sinned, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin offering; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin.

name: Leviticus 5:7
text: ""If he can"t afford a lamb, then he shall bring his trespass offering for that in which he has sinned, two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, to Yahweh; one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering.

name: Leviticus 5:8
text: He shall bring them to the priest, who shall first offer the one which is for the sin offering, and wring off its head from its neck, but shall not sever it completely.

name: Leviticus 5:9
text: He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar; and the rest of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.

name: Leviticus 5:10
text: He shall offer the second for a burnt offering, according to the ordinance; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin which he has sinned, and he shall be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 5:11
text: ""But if he can"t afford two turtledoves, or two young pigeons, then he shall bring his offering for that in which he has sinned, the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering. He shall put no oil on it, neither shall he put any frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering.

name: Leviticus 5:12
text: He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take his handful of it as the memorial portion, and burn it on the altar, on the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. It is a sin offering.

name: Leviticus 5:13
text: The priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned in any of these things, and he will be forgiven; and the rest shall be the priest"s, as the meal offering.""

name: Leviticus 5:14
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 5:15
text: "If anyone commits a trespass, and sins unwittingly, in the holy things of Yahweh; then he shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation in silver by shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for a trespass offering.

name: Leviticus 5:16
text: He shall make restitution for that which he has done wrong in the holy thing, and shall add a fifth part to it, and give it to the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the trespass offering, and he will be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 5:17
text: "If anyone sins, and does any of the things which Yahweh has commanded not to be done; though he didn"t know it, yet he is guilty, and shall bear his iniquity.

name: Leviticus 5:18
text: He shall bring a ram without blemish from of the flock, according to your estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning the thing in which he sinned and didn"t know it, and he will be forgiven.

name: Leviticus 5:19
text: It is a trespass offering. He is certainly guilty before Yahweh."

name: Leviticus 6:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 6:2
text: "If anyone sins, and commits a trespass against Yahweh, and deals falsely with his neighbor in a matter of deposit, or of bargain, or of robbery, or has oppressed his neighbor,

name: Leviticus 6:3
text: or has found that which was lost, and dealt falsely therein, and swearing to a lie; in any of all these things that a man does, sinning therein;

name: Leviticus 6:4
text: then it shall be, if he has sinned, and is guilty, he shall restore that which he took by robbery, or the thing which he has gotten by oppression, or the deposit which was committed to him, or the lost thing which he found,

name: Leviticus 6:5
text: or any thing about which he has sworn falsely; he shall restore it even in full, and shall add a fifth part more to it. To him to whom it belongs he shall give it, in the day of his being found guilty.

name: Leviticus 6:6
text: He shall bring his trespass offering to Yahweh, a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation, for a trespass offering, to the priest.

name: Leviticus 6:7
text: The priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh, and he will be forgiven concerning whatever he does to become guilty."

name: Leviticus 6:8
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 6:9
text: "Command Aaron and his sons, saying, "This is the law of the burnt offering: the burnt offering shall be on the hearth on the altar all night until the morning; and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it.

name: Leviticus 6:10
text: The priest shall put on his linen garment, and he shall put on his linen breeches upon his body; and he shall remove the ashes from where the fire has consumed the burnt offering on the altar, and he shall put them beside the altar.

name: Leviticus 6:11
text: He shall take off his garments, and put on other garments, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a clean place.

name: Leviticus 6:12
text: The fire on the altar shall be kept burning on it, it shall not go out; and the priest shall burn wood on it every morning: and he shall lay the burnt offering in order upon it, and shall burn on it the fat of the peace offerings.

name: Leviticus 6:13
text: Fire shall be kept burning on the altar continually; it shall not go out.

name: Leviticus 6:14
text: ""This is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before Yahweh, before the altar.

name: Leviticus 6:15
text: He shall take from there his handful of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense which is on the meal offering, and shall burn it on the altar for a pleasant aroma, as its memorial, to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 6:16
text: That which is left of it Aaron and his sons shall eat. It shall be eaten without yeast in a holy place. They shall eat it in the court of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 6:17
text: It shall not be baked with yeast. I have given it as their portion of my offerings made by fire. It is most holy, as the sin offering, and as the trespass offering.

name: Leviticus 6:18
text: Every male among the children of Aaron shall eat of it, as their portion forever throughout your generations, from the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. Whoever touches them shall be holy.""

name: Leviticus 6:19
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 6:20
text: "This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to Yahweh in the day when he is anointed: the tenth part of an ephah of fine flour for a meal offering perpetually, half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening.

name: Leviticus 6:21
text: It shall be made with oil in a griddle. When it is soaked, you shall bring it in. You shall offer the meal offering in baked pieces for a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 6:22
text: The anointed priest that will be in his place from among his sons shall offer it. By a statute forever, it shall be wholly burnt to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 6:23
text: Every meal offering of a priest shall be wholly burned. It shall not be eaten."

name: Leviticus 6:24
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 6:25
text: "Speak to Aaron and to his sons, saying, "This is the law of the sin offering: in the place where the burnt offering is killed, the sin offering shall be killed before Yahweh. It is most holy.

name: Leviticus 6:26
text: The priest who offers it for sin shall eat it. It shall be eaten in a holy place, in the court of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 6:27
text: Whatever shall touch its flesh shall be holy. When there is any of its blood sprinkled on a garment, you shall wash that on which it was sprinkled in a holy place.

name: Leviticus 6:28
text: But the earthen vessel in which it is boiled shall be broken; and if it is boiled in a bronze vessel, it shall be scoured, and rinsed in water.

name: Leviticus 6:29
text: Every male among the priests shall eat of it: it is most holy.

name: Leviticus 6:30
text: No sin offering, of which any of the blood is brought into the Tent of Meeting to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be eaten: it shall be burned with fire.

name: Leviticus 7:1
text: ""This is the law of the trespass offering. It is most holy.

name: Leviticus 7:2
text: In the place where they kill the burnt offering, he shall kill the trespass offering; and its blood he shall sprinkle around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 7:3
text: He shall offer all of its fat: the fat tail, and the fat that covers the innards,

name: Leviticus 7:4
text: and the two kidneys, and the fat that is on them, which is by the loins, and the cover on the liver, with the kidneys, shall he take away;

name: Leviticus 7:5
text: and the priest shall burn them on the altar for an offering made by fire to Yahweh: it is a trespass offering.

name: Leviticus 7:6
text: Every male among the priests may eat of it. It shall be eaten in a holy place. It is most holy.

name: Leviticus 7:7
text: ""As is the sin offering, so is the trespass offering; there is one law for them. The priest who makes atonement with them shall have it.

name: Leviticus 7:8
text: The priest who offers any man"s burnt offering, even the priest shall have for himself the skin of the burnt offering which he has offered.

name: Leviticus 7:9
text: Every meal offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is dressed in the pan, and on the griddle, shall be the priest"s who offers it.

name: Leviticus 7:10
text: Every meal offering, mixed with oil or dry, belongs to all the sons of Aaron, one as well as another.

name: Leviticus 7:11
text: ""This is the law of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which one shall offer to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 7:12
text: If he offers it for a thanksgiving, then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mixed with oil.

name: Leviticus 7:13
text: With cakes of leavened bread he shall offer his offering with the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving.

name: Leviticus 7:14
text: Of it he shall offer one out of each offering for a heave offering to Yahweh. It shall be the priest"s who sprinkles the blood of the peace offerings.

name: Leviticus 7:15
text: The flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving shall be eaten on the day of his offering. He shall not leave any of it until the morning.

name: Leviticus 7:16
text: ""But if the sacrifice of his offering is a vow, or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day that he offers his sacrifice; and on the next day what remains of it shall be eaten:

name: Leviticus 7:17
text: but what remains of the flesh of the sacrifice on the third day shall be burned with fire.

name: Leviticus 7:18
text: If any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is eaten on the third day, it will not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed to him who offers it. It will be an abomination, and the soul who eats any of it will bear his iniquity.

name: Leviticus 7:19
text: ""The flesh that touches any unclean thing shall not be eaten. It shall be burned with fire. As for the flesh, everyone who is clean may eat it;

name: Leviticus 7:20
text: but the soul who eats of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that belongs to Yahweh, having his uncleanness on him, that soul shall be cut off from his people.

name: Leviticus 7:21
text: When anyone touches any unclean thing, the uncleanness of man, or an unclean animal, or any unclean abomination, and eats some of the flesh of the sacrifice of peace offerings, which belong to Yahweh, that soul shall be cut off from his people.""

name: Leviticus 7:22
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 7:23
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, "You shall eat no fat, of bull, or sheep, or goat.

name: Leviticus 7:24
text: The fat of that which dies of itself, and the fat of that which is torn of animals, may be used for any other service, but you shall in no way eat of it.

name: Leviticus 7:25
text: For whoever eats the fat of the animal, of which men offer an offering made by fire to Yahweh, even the soul who eats it shall be cut off from his people.

name: Leviticus 7:26
text: You shall not eat any blood, whether it is of bird or of animal, in any of your dwellings.

name: Leviticus 7:27
text: Whoever it is who eats any blood, that soul shall be cut off from his people.""

name: Leviticus 7:28
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 7:29
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, "He who offers the sacrifice of his peace offerings to Yahweh shall bring his offering to Yahweh out of the sacrifice of his peace offerings.

name: Leviticus 7:30
text: With his own hands he shall bring the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. He shall bring the fat with the breast, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 7:31
text: The priest shall burn the fat on the altar, but the breast shall be Aaron"s and his sons".

name: Leviticus 7:32
text: The right thigh you shall give to the priest for a heave offering out of the sacrifices of your peace offerings.

name: Leviticus 7:33
text: He among the sons of Aaron who offers the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion.

name: Leviticus 7:34
text: For the waved breast and the heaved thigh I have taken from the children of Israel out of the sacrifices of their peace offerings, and have given them to Aaron the priest and to his sons as their portion forever from the children of Israel.""

name: Leviticus 7:35
text: This is the anointing portion of Aaron, and the anointing portion of his sons, out of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire, in the day when he presented them to minister to Yahweh in the priest"s office;

name: Leviticus 7:36
text: which Yahweh commanded to be given them of the children of Israel, in the day that he anointed them. It is their portion forever throughout their generations.

name: Leviticus 7:37
text: This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecration, and of the sacrifice of peace offerings;

name: Leviticus 7:38
text: which Yahweh commanded Moses in Mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their offerings to Yahweh, in the wilderness of Sinai.

name: Leviticus 8:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

name: Leviticus 8:2
text: "Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, and the anointing oil, and the bull of the sin offering, and the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread;

name: Leviticus 8:3
text: and assemble all the congregation at the door of the Tent of Meeting."

name: Leviticus 8:4
text: Moses did as Yahweh commanded him; and the congregation was assembled at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

name: Leviticus 8:5
text: Moses said to the congregation, "This is the thing which Yahweh has commanded to be done."

name: Leviticus 8:6
text: Moses brought Aaron and his sons, and washed them with water.

name: Leviticus 8:7
text: He put the coat on him, tied the sash on him, clothed him with the robe, put the ephod on him, and he tied the skillfully woven band of the ephod on him, and fastened it to him with it.

name: Leviticus 8:8
text: He placed the breastplate on him; and in the breastplate he put the Urim and the Thummim.

name: Leviticus 8:9
text: He set the turban on his head; and on the turban, in front, he set the golden plate, the holy crown; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 8:10
text: Moses took the anointing oil, and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and sanctified them.

name: Leviticus 8:11
text: He sprinkled it on the altar seven times, and anointed the altar and all its vessels, and the basin and its base, to sanctify them.

name: Leviticus 8:12
text: He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron"s head, and anointed him, to sanctify him.

name: Leviticus 8:13
text: Moses brought Aaron"s sons, and clothed them with coats, and tied sashes on them, and put headbands on them; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 8:14
text: He brought the bull of the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the bull of the sin offering.

name: Leviticus 8:15
text: He killed it; and Moses took the blood, and put it around on the horns of the altar with his finger, and purified the altar, and poured out the blood at the base of the altar, and sanctified it, to make atonement for it.

name: Leviticus 8:16
text: He took all the fat that was on the innards, and the cover of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat; and Moses burned it on the altar.

name: Leviticus 8:17
text: But the bull, and its skin, and its flesh, and its dung, he burned with fire outside the camp; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 8:18
text: He presented the ram of the burnt offering: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.

name: Leviticus 8:19
text: He killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 8:20
text: He cut the ram into its pieces; and Moses burned the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

name: Leviticus 8:21
text: He washed the innards and the legs with water; and Moses burned the whole ram on the altar. It was a burnt offering for a pleasant aroma. It was an offering made by fire to Yahweh; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 8:22
text: He presented the other ram, the ram of consecration: and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.

name: Leviticus 8:23
text: He killed it; and Moses took some of its blood, and put it on the tip of Aaron"s right ear, and on the thumb of his right hand, and on the great toe of his right foot.

name: Leviticus 8:24
text: He brought Aaron"s sons; and Moses put some of the blood on the tip of their right ear, and on the thumb of their right hand, and on the great toe of their right foot; and Moses sprinkled the blood around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 8:25
text: He took the fat, and the fat tail, and all the fat that was on the innards, and the cover of the liver, and the two kidneys, and their fat, and the right thigh;

name: Leviticus 8:26
text: and out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before Yahweh, he took one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat, and on the right thigh.

name: Leviticus 8:27
text: He put all these in Aaron"s hands and in his sons" hands, and waved them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 8:28
text: Moses took them from their hands, and burned them on the altar on the burnt offering. They were a consecration for a pleasant aroma. It was an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 8:29
text: Moses took the breast, and waved it for a wave offering before Yahweh. It was Moses" portion of the ram of consecration, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 8:30
text: Moses took some of the anointing oil, and some of the blood which was on the altar, and sprinkled it on Aaron, on his garments, and on his sons, and on his sons" garments with him, and sanctified Aaron, his garments, and his sons, and his sons" garments with him.

name: Leviticus 8:31
text: Moses said to Aaron and to his sons, "Boil the flesh at the door of the Tent of Meeting, and there eat it and the bread that is in the basket of consecration, as I commanded, saying, "Aaron and his sons shall eat it."

name: Leviticus 8:32
text: What remains of the flesh and of the bread you shall burn with fire.

name: Leviticus 8:33
text: You shall not go out from the door of the Tent of Meeting seven days, until the days of your consecration are fulfilled: for he shall consecrate you seven days.

name: Leviticus 8:34
text: What has been done this day, so Yahweh has commanded to do, to make atonement for you.

name: Leviticus 8:35
text: You shall stay at the door of the Tent of Meeting day and night seven days, and keep Yahweh"s command, that you don"t die: for so I am commanded."

name: Leviticus 8:36
text: Aaron and his sons did all the things which Yahweh commanded by Moses.

name: Leviticus 9:1
text: It happened on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

name: Leviticus 9:2
text: and he said to Aaron, "Take a calf from the herd for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering, without blemish, and offer them before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 9:3
text: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, "Take a male goat for a sin offering; and a calf and a lamb, both a year old, without blemish, for a burnt offering;

name: Leviticus 9:4
text: and a bull and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before Yahweh; and a meal offering mixed with oil: for today Yahweh appears to you.""

name: Leviticus 9:5
text: They brought what Moses commanded before the Tent of Meeting: and all the congregation drew near and stood before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 9:6
text: Moses said, "This is the thing which Yahweh commanded that you should do: and the glory of Yahweh shall appear to you."

name: Leviticus 9:7
text: Moses said to Aaron, "Draw near to the altar, and offer your sin offering, and your burnt offering, and make atonement for yourself, and for the people; and offer the offering of the people, and make atonement for them; as Yahweh commanded."

name: Leviticus 9:8
text: So Aaron drew near to the altar, and killed the calf of the sin offering, which was for himself.

name: Leviticus 9:9
text: The sons of Aaron presented the blood to him; and he dipped his finger in the blood, and put it on the horns of the altar, and poured out the blood at the base of the altar:

name: Leviticus 9:10
text: but the fat, and the kidneys, and the cover from the liver of the sin offering, he burned upon the altar; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

name: Leviticus 9:11
text: The flesh and the skin he burned with fire outside the camp.

name: Leviticus 9:12
text: He killed the burnt offering; and Aaron"s sons delivered the blood to him, and he sprinkled it around on the altar.

name: Leviticus 9:13
text: They delivered the burnt offering to him, piece by piece, and the head: and he burned them upon the altar.

name: Leviticus 9:14
text: He washed the innards and the legs, and burned them on the burnt offering on the altar.

name: Leviticus 9:15
text: He presented the people"s offering, and took the goat of the sin offering which was for the people, and killed it, and offered it for sin, like the first.

name: Leviticus 9:16
text: He presented the burnt offering, and offered it according to the ordinance.

name: Leviticus 9:17
text: He presented the meal offering, and filled his hand from there, and burned it upon the altar, besides the burnt offering of the morning.

name: Leviticus 9:18
text: He also killed the bull and the ram, the sacrifice of peace offerings, which was for the people: and Aaron"s sons delivered to him the blood, which he sprinkled around on the altar,

name: Leviticus 9:19
text: and the fat of the bull and of the ram, the fat tail, and that which covers the innards, and the kidneys, and the cover of the liver:

name: Leviticus 9:20
text: and they put the fat upon the breasts, and he burned the fat on the altar:

name: Leviticus 9:21
text: and the breasts and the right thigh Aaron waved for a wave offering before Yahweh, as Moses commanded.

name: Leviticus 9:22
text: Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people, and blessed them; and he came down from offering the sin offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings.

name: Leviticus 9:23
text: Moses and Aaron went into the Tent of Meeting, and came out, and blessed the people: and the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the people.

name: Leviticus 9:24
text: There came forth fire from before Yahweh, and consumed the burnt offering and the fat upon the altar: and when all the people saw it, they shouted, and fell on their faces.

name: Leviticus 10:1
text: Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer, and put fire in it, and laid incense on it, and offered strange fire before Yahweh, which he had not commanded them.

name: Leviticus 10:2
text: And fire came forth from before Yahweh, and devoured them, and they died before Yahweh.

name: Leviticus 10:3
text: Then Moses said to Aaron, "This is what Yahweh spoke of, saying, "I will show myself holy to those who come near me, and before all the people I will be glorified."" Aaron held his peace.

name: Leviticus 10:4
text: Moses called Mishael and Elzaphan, the sons of Uzziel the uncle of Aaron, and said to them, "Draw near, carry your brothers from before the sanctuary out of the camp."

name: Leviticus 10:5
text: So they drew near, and carried them in their coats out of the camp, as Moses had said.

name: Leviticus 10:6
text: Moses said to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons, "Don"t let the hair of your heads go loose, neither tear your clothes; that you don"t die, and that he not be angry with all the congregation: but let your brothers, the whole house of Israel, bewail the burning which Yahweh has kindled.

name: Leviticus 10:7
text: You shall not go out from the door of the Tent of Meeting, lest you die; for the anointing oil of Yahweh is on you." They did according to the word of Moses.

name: Leviticus 10:8
text: Yahweh spoke to Aaron, saying,

name: Leviticus 10:9
text: "Drink no wine nor strong drink, you, nor your sons with you, when you go into the Tent of Meeting, that you don"t die: it shall be a statute forever throughout your generations:

name: Leviticus 10:10
text: and that you are to make a distinction between the holy and the common, and between the unclean and the clean;

name: Leviticus 10:11
text: and that you are to teach the children of Israel all the statutes which Yahweh has spoken to them by Moses."

name: Leviticus 10:12
text: Moses spoke to Aaron, and to Eleazar and to Ithamar, his sons who were left, "Take the meal offering that remains of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire, and eat it without yeast beside the altar; for it is most holy;

name: Leviticus 10:13
text: and you shall eat it in a holy place, because it is your portion, and your sons" portion, of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire: for so I am commanded.

name: Leviticus 10:14
text: The waved breast and the heaved thigh you shall eat in a clean place, you, and your sons, and your daughters with you: for they are given as your portion, and your sons" portion, out of the sacrifices of the peace offerings of the children of Israel.

name: Leviticus 10:15
text: The heaved thigh and the waved breast they shall bring with the offerings made by fire of the fat, to wave it for a wave offering before Yahweh: and it shall be yours, and your sons" with you, as a portion forever; as Yahweh has commanded."

name: Leviticus 10:16
text: Moses diligently inquired about the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burned: and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,

name: Leviticus 10:17
text: "Why haven"t you eaten the sin offering in the place of the sanctuary, since it is most holy, and he has given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before Yahweh?

name: Leviticus 10:18
text: Behold, its blood was not brought into the inner part of the sanctuary: you certainly should have eaten it in the sanctuary, as I commanded."

name: Leviticus 10:19
text: Aaron spoke to Moses, "Behold, this day they have offered their sin offering and their burnt offering before Yahweh; and such things as these have happened to me: and if I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been pleasing in the sight of Yahweh?"

name: Leviticus 10:20
text: When Moses heard that, it was pleasing in his sight.

name: Leviticus 11:1
text: Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Aaron, saying to them,

name: Leviticus 11:2
text: "Speak to the children of Israel, saying, "These are the living things which you may eat among all the animals that are on the earth.

name: Leviticus 11:3
text: Whatever parts the hoof, and is cloven-footed, and chews the cud among the animals, that you may eat.

name: Leviticus 11:4
text: ""Nevertheless these you shall not eat of those that chew the cud, or of those who part the hoof: the camel, because he chews the cud but doesn"t have a parted hoof, he is unclean to you.
